Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, High Jump, Hover, Imperial, Protocol, Sith Force, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Temple Exterior

Canister 1
This Canister can be found hiding behind the pillars on the left side of the area.








Canister 2
As you approach the stairs to the temple, you'll see some large white panels stuck in the rubble.








Forcing three of these panels will form a tower. Hop up the platforms, allowing you to high jump to this Canister.







Canister 3
There is a node to the right of the temple entrance. Destroy it to reveal a grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then head to the left and hop up the ledges.








You'll find a large window. Sith Force it to destroy it, then hop inside.








You'll find some silver LEGO pieces in the alcove. Toss a thermal detonator at them to loosen them up, allowing you to build them into this Canister.







Part 2 - Temple Ruins

Canister 4
After walking up the red steps, you'll find an Imperial panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







You'll find this Canister floating above the hologram projector in the center of the room.








Canister 5
As you approach the entrance to the archives, you'll notice a flight of stairs.








Head down it and head to the left, where you'll see this Canister floating past the ledge. Hover over to it to collect it (you can also just leap to your death).







Canister 6
After collecting Canister 5, head back to the right and you'll find the entrance to the Jedi Council chamber.







Head inside and Force the chairs into a tower, then hop up them and high jump up to this Canister.








Part 3 - Jedi Archives

Canister 7
You'll find this Canister in the top right alcove. To reach it, Force the panels in the wall to extend them into platforms. Hop on them, then onto the ledge with this Canister.






Canister 8
This Canister can be found in the bottom right alcove. Simply high jump onto the ledge to reach it.








Canister 9
After Forcing the three levers in the alcoves on the right, the crane arm will move out of the way, clearing the door. It will stop on the right, creating a platform.






High jump onto it and you'll see a ledge on the left.









High jump onto it, then hop onto the next ledge.









Continue all the way to the left side of the ledge, where you'll find that the force field has an opening above it.







Drop down inside to reach this Canister.









Red Power Brick (Deflect Bolts)
After collecting Canister 9, use the Protocol panel to lower the force fields blocking the alcoves on the left.







There are three levers in these alcoves that you need to Force. Two of them can be reached by first Forcing the panels out of the wall, then high jumping onto them. High jump up to the ledges with the levers.





The other lever can be reached by using the grapple point to reach the ledge with the lever. The lever is blocked by a force field, so high jump onto the ledge above it and step on the button to lower the force field.





Once all three levers have been Forced, the crane arm on the left will move into position. Return to the upper ledge and hop onto the platform on the crane arm, allowing you to high jump up to this Power Brick.
Ruin of the Jedi - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 4 - Records Room

Canister 10
On the left side of the room are two buttons. Destroy the silver barrier on the left and Sith Force the barrier on the right to clear the buttons. Step on one button and your partner will step on the other.






This will lower a force field on the right, allowing you to destroy these silver objects.








Destroying them will reveal LEGO pieces, so build them into a lever.








Force it to lower the force field around this Canister, allowing you to collect it.








Minikit Model: ARC Fighter
Ruin of the Jedi - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, High Jump, Imperial, Protocol

Part 1 - Temple Exterior

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found by a node to the right of your starting point.








Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found on the far right side of the area.








Blue Canister 3
After collecting Blue Canister 2, head back to the left to find a node.








Destroy it to reveal a grapple point, then use it to grapple onto the ledge.








Hop up the ledges to the left, where you'll find this Blue Canister.








Part 2 - Temple Ruins

Blue Canister 4
Head left instead of hopping up the red steps and you'll find a large ball. This Blue Canister is hiding behind it. You don't have to Force the ball to collect the Blue Canister, but it does make it easier to see.






Blue Canister 5
After hopping up the red steps, you'll find an Imperial panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







You'll find this Blue Canister tucked away on the left side of the room.








Blue Canister 6
On your way to the archive entrance, you'll notice a flight of stairs.








Head down them and you'll find the entrance to the Jedi Council chambers.








Head inside and you'll find this Blue Canister on the left side of the room.








Part 3 - Jedi Archives

Blue Canister 7
Head into the second alcove on the left to find this Blue Canister on a ledge. Use the grapple point to reach it.







Blue Canister 8
After you clear the exit, you'll notice the crane arm will move to create a platform.








High jump onto it, then onto the ledge on the left. High jump onto the next ledge, where you'll find this Blue Canister.







Blue Canister 9
After collecting Blue Canister 8, continue to the left across the ledges.








At the end, you'll find a force field. Hop inside and use the Protocol panel to shut off the force fields blocking off the alcoves on the left.







Head into the alcove on the bottom left and Force the panels out of the wall. High jump onto the platform, then high jump up onto the ledge with the lever. This Blue Canister can be found on the ledge above it.





Part 4 - Records Room

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the room.
Darth Vader - Story Mode
Anakin Skywalker, once the young Podracing champion of Tatooine, Padawan to Obi-Wan Kenobi and hero of the Clone Wars, has finally given in to his secret emotions and fallen to the Dark Side.

His wife Padme rushes to the volcanic world of Mustafar, hoping to turn Anakin back from his dark path. She has no idea that Anakin's former master Obi-Wan is hiding aboard her ship....

Boss: Anakin Skywalker (Jedi)
Starting Characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi (Episode III), Anakin Skywalker (Jedi)
True Jedi: 25,000

Part 1 – Collapsing Hallway

As soon as you start this level, you will be placed in danger. The floor in the hallway is collapsing, so run towards the camera and avoid the lava. Eventually, you will have to hop across the gaps, so do so carefully. If you die, you’ll have to restart this section. Try to space out your double jumps so you cover more distance with each leap.

Part 2 – Control Room

You’ll notice a timer in the center of the screen. This tells you how much time you have before the entire room explodes. If you’re still in the room when it explodes, you will die and have to restart the area. You can Force the pillars lying around to add 20 seconds to the timer.

To exit the room, head to the right. You’ll find some collapsed pillars in front of a door. Force them out of the way, then Force one of the orange clasps. Your partner will Force the other, opening the door. Head outside.

Part 3 – Collapsing Ledge

The ledge you are standing on will begin to collapse, so make your way quickly to the right. If you die, you’ll have to restart this area. Destroy the yellow pillars to reveal buttons, then step on one. Your partner will step on the other, lowering the panel to the right. Continue to the right and there will be an explosion.

You will be damaged if you continue to the right, so Force the yellow valve on the wall. This will power up a force field, allowing your partner to Force the other valve. This will make it safe for you to continue. Force one of the red things on the right and your partner will Force the other, then Force the panel to raise up a platform. Hop onto it.

Part 4 – Lava River

Carefully hop across the ledges, then hop across the platforms in the lava. If you die, you’ll have to restart this area. Your goal is to get to the large pillar in the back. Once you reach it, hop up the ledges. The pillar will collapse, so hop from it onto the rock platform in the back.

Part 5 – Battle of the Heroes

This is fun. The fight itself is pretty simple. Duel Anakin to take out his hearts. As you fight, pieces of the platform will fall off, so watch out and try not to fall into the lava. If you can force Anakin to fall into the lava, he will take damage before he leaps back onto the rock. Take out all of Anakin’s hearts to complete the level.
Darth Vader - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Hover

Part 1 - Collapsing Hallway

Canister 1
This Canister can be found on the left side of the hallway.








Part 2 - Control Room

Canister 2
Force the two orange handles on the left side of the room to destroy the computer screen, revealing this Canister.







Red Power Brick (Dark Side)
There is an Astromech panel on the left side of the room.








Use it to open the door, then head inside to find this Power Brick on the table.








Canister 3
On the left side of the room, you'll see this Canister behind a grate. Force the orange handle in front of it to lower the grate, allowing you to collect this Canister.






Canister 4
Destroy the blue-and-yellow panel on the left side of the room to reveal this Canister hiding behind it.








Canister 5
This Canister is just hanging out in the back of the room.








Part 3 - Collapsing Ledge

Canister 6
This Canister is right behind you as you enter this area.








Canister 7
This Canister can be found on the platform you lower by stepping on the buttons.








Part 4 - Lava River

Canister 8
This Canister can be found on a platform on the right side of the lava.








Canister 9
This Canister can be found on a platform on the left side of the lava.








Canister 10
You can find this Canister on a rock platform on the right side of the lava. If you try to hover to the rock however, you'll fall into the lava.







To collect this Canister, hop onto the pillar and look to the right as it falls. You'll see a platform on the right. Hover over to the platform and you'll be able to hop onto the rocks with this Canister.






Minikit Model: V wing
Darth Vader - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Hover

Part 1 - Collapsing Hallway

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found right behind you as you start the level.








Part 2 - Control Room

Blue Canister 2
On the left side of the room you'll find an Astromech panel.








Use it to open the door, then head inside to find this Blue Canister on the table.








Blue Canister 3
On the left side of the room, you'll find a blue-and-yellow panel. Destroy it to reveal this Blue Canister hiding behind it.







Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is in plain sight in the back of the room.








Part 3 - Collapsing Ledge

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is right next to you as you enter this area.








Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister can be found on the ledge you lower by stepping on the buttons.








Part 4 - Lava River

Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the final piece of the support structure.








Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is on a platform on the left side of the lava.








Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found on a platform on the right side of the lava.








Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on a rock platform to the right of where you fight Anakin. If you are playing as Jango or Boba Fett, you can hover over to this Blue Canister from this platform.






If you don't have one of the Fetts, you can still get this Blue Canister. While standing on the collapsing pillar, look to the right to find a platform. Hover to it, allowing you to hover to the rock platform with this Blue Canister.
Character Bonus - Mustafar
As the Republic struggles to deal with the Trade Federation threat, and the evil Sith plan to destroy the Jedi, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

On the volcanic Mustafar system in the Outer Rim, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

There are lots of little rock platforms scattered throughout this area, and they each have lots of boxes on them. Destroy the silver objects and some of the boxes to reveal Power Ups, which really make this Character Bonus a breeze. Since this area is so tightly packed, go crazy when you have a Power Up, as you'll draw in lots of studs from your surroundings.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
Minikit Bonus - Kashyyyk
As the Republic struggles to deal with the Trade Federation threat, and the evil Sith plan to destroy the Jedi, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

On the Wookiee homeworld of Kashyyyk, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

This area is rather small, with lots of plants and boxes dotting the beaches and forests. Destroy the torpedo targets on the white structures to reveal Power Ups. You can also get Power Ups by destroying certain boxes and plants. Since everything is rather clustered together, take advantage of the Power Ups to draw in as many studs as you can.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
-------Episode IV - A New Hope-------
Secret Plans - Story Mode
It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.

During the battle, Rebel spies managed to steal secret plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the Death Star, an armored space station with enough power to destroy an entire planet.

Pursued by the Empire's sinister agents, Princess Leia races home aboard her starship, custodian of the stolen plans that can save her people and restore freedom to the galaxy....

Enemies: Stormtrooper, Imperial Officer, Beach Trooper, Imperial Shuttle Pilot
Starting Characters: Princess Leia, Captain Antilles
Added Characters: C-3PO, R2-D2, Rebel Friend
True Jedi: 28,000

Part 1 – Securing the Plans

We’ve got the plans, now we just need to get them to R2. Build the two piles of LEGO pieces into computer panels. This will send power to the door in front of you, opening it. Continue on down the hallway, then pull one of the levers. Your partner will pull the other one, opening the door into the hallway.

You’ll notice some rebel troopers running left down the hallway, so follow them. The door at the end of the hallway will be breached by stormtroopers, so dispatch them. Defeat two more waves of stormtroopers and the smoke in the doorway will clear. Your rebel friends will run inside, so follow them.

Part 2 – Learning to Grapple

Head to the right side of the room to find a grapple point. Use it to grapple onto the first ledge, then follow it around to the left. Use the next grapple point to reach the final ledge. Head back to the right and you’ll find two piles of LEGO pieces. Build them into generators. This will extend the bridge across the gap. Cross the bridge and head through the door at the end.

Part 3 – Evading Vader

Uh oh. Looks like we took a wrong turn. If you try to run past Vader he will Force you back, so looks like we’ll have to scare him off. Pull one or both sets of levers to drop off a bomb or two next to Vader. Shoot a bomb five times to detonate it (you don't have to detonate both, just one), spooking Vader and causing him to run away.

Head down the hallway and enter the next hallway, then take a left. Continue down the hallway and head through the door at the end.

Part 4 – The Droids We’re Looking For

We gotta get through that door. To open it, we need to move two boxes. Each box is on a set of tiles, with a slot in the floor at some point on the tiles. Push each box into the slot. This will open the door, revealing three stormtroopers. Dispose of them, then walk up to C-3PO to add him to your party. Use the Protocol panel to lower the shield, then walk up to R2 to start a cutscene.

After the cutscene, Princess Leia will no longer be in the party, but you’ll have R2-D2. Continue down the hallway and use the Astromech panel to open the door. Head inside.

Part 5 – A Friend in Need

As you enter this room, you’ll see a poor soul trapped in an endless battle with two stormtroopers. If you try to shoot at them, you won't harm them, so we need to find another way to dispose of them. Thankfully, there is a crane nearby. Hop in and use it to pick up the two stormtroopers and drop them into the smoke.

After defeating the stormtroopers, your new friend will pull the lever on the right side of the room. This will lower the platforms to the right, creating a bridge for you to cross and adding Rebel Friend to your party.

You’ll notice how C-3PO crosses the bridge on his own. Wait for him to stop moving, then hop in the crane and pick him up. Carry him over the gap and drop him in front of the Protocol panel by the door. With C-3PO in place, you can now hop out of the crane and cross the bridge. Hop across the gap (be careful, it’s wider than it looks), then use the Protocol panel to open the door. Head inside.

Part 6 – Escaping the Tantive IV

When you enter this hallway, you’ll observe some rebel troopers being escorted by stormtroopers. Take out the stormtroopers, then defeat the incoming waves of troopers. You’ll know you’re close to the end when the Beach Trooper appears. Once the waves are defeated, the smoke will clear and you can continue down the hallway.

Build the LEGO pieces into a bridge, allowing C-3PO to cross the gap. Continue down the hallway and take a right. Continue down the hallway and build the next pile of LEGO pieces into another bridge for C-3PO, then continue to the escape pods. The pod on the right is where you need to go, but the Protocol panel to open it is covered up.

To uncover it, use each of the Astromech panels by the other two escape pods to open them up. Head inside and pull the levers. Once both levers are pulled, the Protocol panel will be revealed. Use it to open the escape pod, then head inside and use the Astromech panel to complete the level.

Unlocked Characters: Princess Leia, Captain Antilles, Rebel Friend, Rebel Trooper (10,000), Stormtrooper (10,000), Imperial Shuttle Pilot (25,000)

You will also unlock C-3PO and R2-D2 if you haven’t already
Secret Plans - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Imperial, Protocol, Sith Force, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Securing the Plans

Canister 1
When you enter the first hallway, take a right and you'll find this mysterious black door.








Sith Force it to destroy it, revealing this Canister inside the room.








Part 2 - Learning to Grapple

Canister 2
You can see this Canister hiding underneath the floor. That travel chute is a red herring, it won't lead you to this Canister.







To reach this Canister, destroy the silver object on the ground to reveal a hole, allowing you to drop down and collect this Canister.







Canister 3
While on the top ledge, you'll notice two panels that you can Force.








Force the panels to create platforms, then hop up to reach this Canister.








Part 3 - Evading Vader

Canister 4
Head to the right as you enter this area and you'll find a Bounty Hunter panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Inside the new area, head straight down the hallway and you'll find two small white panels.








Stand next to them and they will raise up, revealing LEGO pieces.








Build them into a door, which will then open and reveal this Canister.








Red Power Brick (Super blasters)
After collecting Canister 4, head back down the hallway, then take a left and continue down the hall. Eventually, you'll find your path blocked by a shield. Use the Protocol panel to deactivate it, then continue on down the hallway and go through the door at the end.




Inside, you'll find a bunch of sprinklers. The ones we're interested in are on the right.








Force each of the sprinklers down to water the plants.








Destroy the plants to reveal this Power Brick.









Canister 5
You need to reveal 3 little boxes with a fruit symbol on them (these are called fruit pickups in the handheld version of this game). The first can be found by destroying the box to the left of the Bounty Hunter panel.





To find the next fruit pickup, use the Bounty Hunter panel to open the door. Head inside the hallway, then take a left. Continue down the hallway and you'll find a box on the right. Destroy it to reveal the second fruit pickup.





After revealing the second fruit pickup, continue down the hallway and use the Protocol panel to lower the shield. Destroy the first box on the left to reveal the final fruit pickup.






Once you have revealed all three fruit pickups, this Canister will appear in front of the door to Canister 4.







Part 4 - The Droids We're Looking For

Canister 6
On the right side of the room are two boxes.









Force them to create a small tower, then hop up them to reach the ledge with this Canister on it.








Canister 7
This one is sneaky. After using the Protocol panel, Force the first orange panel on the upper left side of the hallway. This will open a secret passageway (which is immediately to the left of Darth Vader) with this Canister inside.
Secret Plans - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 5 - A Friend In Need

Canister 8
There is a lift in this area that you can only use if you are in a vehicle.








Simply ride onto the lift and you will be raised up to this Canister. The only problem is, you'll need to make your vehicle. In this screenshot, I am in an ATV, which can be made by destroying the silver object near the second fruit pickup (see Canister 5).





You can also construct a milk truck to help you collect this Canister. To build it, head to the room where you can collect the Red Power Brick.







Force these three sprinklers in the back to grow the plants.








Destroy them to reveal three sets of LEGO pieces. Build them, then Force them together to create a milk truck. Now you can ride it from here all the way to the lift.






Part 6 - Escaping the Tantive IV

Canister 9
There are 3 flowers that you need to reveal. The first can be found by destroying the center wall on the left side of the hallway.







To find the second, use the Imperial panel in the hallway as you approach the escape pods to open the door.







Head inside and destroy the box on the right to reveal this. If you want, you can build the LEGO pieces in here into Protocol panels, then use them to launch Imperials into space.






The third flower can be found by destroying this large silver object in the hall.








Once all 3 flowers have been revealed, this Canister will appear in front of the escape pods.








Canister 10
Inside the escape pod with the Beach Troopers, you'll find a tub. Sith Force the drain to empty the tub and reveal this Canister.







Minikit Model: Star Destroyer
Secret Plans - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Bounty Hunter, Grapple, Hover, Protocol, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Securing the Plans

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is immediately to the left of your starting point.








Blue Canister 2
When you enter the first hallway, take a right and you'll find this Blue Canister to the left of the black door.







Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the hallway by a Protocol panel.








Part 2 - Learning to Grapple

Blue Canister 4
You can see this Blue Canister underneath the floor.








Destroy the silver object to reveal a hole in the floor, allowing you to drop down and collect this.








Part 3 - Evading Vader

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is floating right above Vader









Blue Canister 6
After passing Vader, head to the right and you'll find a Bounty Hunter panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Head down the hallway, then take a left at the fork.









Continue down the hallway and you'll find this Blue Canister behind a shield. Use the Protocol panel to lower the shield, allowing you to collect this.







Blue Canister 7
After passing Vader, there will be some wall panels you can destroy before entering the final hallway.








Destroy the wall panel on the far left to reveal this Blue Canister, which was hiding behind them.








Part 4 - The Droids We're Looking For

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is tucked away in the back right corner of the room with the boxes.








Part 5 - A Friend in Need

Blue Canister 9
You'll see this Blue Canister on a ledge above you. To reach it, destroy the box to reveal a grapple point. Grapple up to reach the ledge, then hover over to this Blue Canister.






Part 6 - Escaping the Tantive IV

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is right in your path as you approach the escape pods.
Through the Jundland Wastes - Story Mode
Darth Vader searches in vain for the secret Rebel plans on Princess Leia's starship. The droid R2-D2 has escaped with the Death Star blueprints to the planet Tatooine below.

But R2-D2, along with his companion C-3PO, has been captured by Jawas, small scavenger creatures who trade in mechanical scrap.

Young Luke Skywalker, unaware of the great destiny which lies before him, is looking for droids to help with work on his uncle's moisture farm. As he approaches the Jawas' Sandcrawler, his life is about to change forever....

Enemies: Tusken Raider, Jawa, Sandtrooper
Starting Characters: Luke Skywalker (Tatooine), Ben Kenobi
Added Characters: R2-D2, C-3PO
True Jedi: 60,000

Part 1 – The Jundland Wastes

The sand people will be back, and in greater numbers, so let’s hurry and get out of here. Head to the right and you’ll see two sand people shooting at you from a ledge. Destroy the pile of red-and-orange rubble on the left to lower a rock. Hop on top of the rock, then hop onto the ledge the sand people were on.

Continue down the path and you’ll reach a sandy slope. If you try to walk up this slope you’ll just slide down. To reach the top, use the Force on the escape pod on the left side of the slope to create a ramp. Walk up the ramp and continue towards the canyon.

Part 2 – Sandcrawler Approach

Head to the right and you’ll notice a pile of LEGO pieces. Build them into a box, then push it along the tiles towards the sand people. Hop on top of the box, then hop across the rock platforms to safely cross the quick sand.

Continue up the path towards the sandcrawler. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, but before you use it, Force the two grey boxes into position. Force the orange panel on the side of the sandcrawler to lower it, then use the grapple point to land on the platform. Pull the lever to reveal a grapple point, as well as extend a platform. This will allow Ben to join you.

Force the next platform on the sandcrawler down, then either grapple or double jump onto it. Pull the lever to start a moving platform. Hop on and ride it to the roof of the sandcrawler, then pull the levers to lower the vacuum tube at the base of the sandcrawler. Jump back down, then head towards the vacuum tube to be sucked inside.

Part 3 – Rescuing R2-D2

Time to get the droids back from the Jawas. Head to the right down the hallway. The hallway will turn to the left, and at the end you’ll find a locked door. There are five red lights above the door that we need to turn green. To do so, destroy the orange ladders on the right side of the hallway. This will reveal yellow valves. Force each of the valves on the right side of the hallway to turn the lights green, opening the door.

Continue into the next room, where you’ll find R2-D2 trapped behind bars. To free him, pull the lever on the right side of the room to reveal a box. Push the box into the space in the tile in front of R2’s cage. This will destroy the bars trapping R2, adding him to your party. Use the Astromech panel to open the elevator door, then head inside.

Part 4 – Sandcrawler Interior

We got R2. Now to get 3PO. The way ahead is behind that gate, but the levers to open it are gone. Step on each set of four buttons in quick succession to reveal the levers, then pull them to open the gate.

Part 5 – Saving C-3PO

The first thing I recommend doing is killing all the Jawas. They will attack your droids with their ion weapons and stun them temporarily, which can be annoying if you’re trying to use a droid panel.

To rescue C-3PO, turn the rotary handle until the vacuum tube is over his cage. Use the Astromech panel on the left to power up the tube, sucking C-3PO out of his cage and adding him to your party.

Use the Protocol panel on the left to open the door, then continue into the next room. Force the four supports (you can also shoot them if you prefer) to lower the back of the sandcrawler, allowing you to escape back into Jundland.

Part 6 – Return to Jundland

Head to the right and you’ll come across a big puddle of quicksand. In order to get past it, you need 3PO to power up the moisture vaporators to drain the quicksand. The problem is, that vaporator is elevated and 3PO can’t get up there. We need to make a path for him.

Begin by using the Protocol panel on the first vaporator on the right. This will drain the quicksand in the small puddle, allowing 3PO to reach the back corner. Build the LEGO pieces into a ramp, allowing 3PO to reach the final vaporator. Use the Protocol panel on it to drain the large puddle of quicksand, allowing you to continue up the path to a small canyon.

Hop up the rock platforms on the left, then Force the Krayt Dragon bones into a bridge, allowing you to cross the canyon. Cross the bridge, then continue along the path. You’ll run into another patch of quicksand, with a vaporator out in the center.

To reach it, hop up the ledges on the right and push the object off the edge. Force the LEGO pieces that appear to create a bridge. Walk across it and use the Protocol panel to drain the quicksand, allowing you to continue along the path towards Ben’s house.

Part 7 – Ben’s House

Ben’s house is just across the gap, which is of course filled with quicksand. Build the LEGO pieces onto the landspeeder, then hop in and ride it across the gap. Unfortunately, you will once again have to create a path for 3PO, so build the LEGO pieces on the other side of the gap into a lever. Pull it to raise a bridge, allowing the rest of your party to join you.

As you head to Ben’s house, you’ll be attacked by a squad of sandtroopers. Once they’re defeated, step on the buttons in front of Ben’s house to extend the lever. Pull it to open the door, then head inside to complete the level.

Unlocked Characters: Luke Skywalker (Tatooine), Ben Kenobi, Tusken Raider (23,000), Jawa (24,000)
Through the Jundland Wastes - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - The Jundland Wastes

Red Power Brick (Fast Force)
Before you cross the bridge where the two sand people are shooting at you, head to the right. The camera will pan to the right, showing you these two silver objects across the gap. Destroy them to clear the path, then hover across the gap.





You'll find three grey boxes laying in the sand.









Force them into a tower, then hop on top of it and onto the nearby rock ledge.








Hover across the gap and you'll reach a mine cart.









Push it to the left off the ledge. It will travel down the tracks and destroy the boards at the end, allowing you to collect this Power Brick.







Canister 1
After collecting the Red Power Brick, Force the orange object to create a platform.








Hop onto it, then hop onto the next ledge. Head to the left, where you'll see this Canister across the gap. Hover across the gap to reach it.







Canister 2
After crossing the small bridge, you'll find this barrier on the left. Sith Force it to destroy it, then head inside the alcove.







Force the LEGO pieces on the left to create a mine.









This will blow a hole in the wall, revealing wooden boards. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces, then Force them into another mine.







This will blow another hole in the wall, allowing you to hop up the ledges to the Canister.








Canister 3
After crossing the small bridge, build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then grapple up onto the ledge.







Hover across the gap to reach the travel chute on the opposite ledge.








Crawl through it to reach a little underground area with this Canister inside.








Part 2 - Sandcrawler Approach

Canister 4
As you're climbing the sandcrawler, you'll notice this Canister behind a shield.








To reach it, head to the left side of the sandcrawler's roof, where you'll find silver hatches.








Destroy them to reveal two buttons.









Step on them and a travel chute will appear. Crawl through it to reach this Canister.








Part 3 - Rescuing R2-D2

Canister 5
This Canister can be found behind bars on the right side of the room. Push a box into the slot in front of it to destroy the bars, allowing you to collect this.







Part 4 - Sandcrawler Interior

Canister 6
On the left side of this area, you'll find some black bars attached to the wall.








Sith Force them to reveal a travel chute. Crawl through it and you'll appear behind the bars to the right.







Move around and those bars will be raised, allowing your partner to join you. Step on the buttons to raise the barrier, then head to the right.







Force this object on the left.









This will reveal an object overheard. Sith Force it.









This will shut off the lava flow, allowing you to hover across the gap to this Canister.
Through the Jundland Wastes - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 6 - Return to Jundland

Canister 7
You can find this Canister on a ledge by the small ramp you build for C-3PO. To reach it, Force the grapple hook onto the ledge, then build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, allowing you to grapple up and reach this.





Canister 8
On the left side of the quicksand field, you'll find a rock held up by scaffolding.








Sith Force it to lower it to the ground, allowing you to hop up into the alcove.








Here, you will find this Canister trapped in a container. To free it, hop on a Bantha and slowly make your way to the large button. Stand the Bantha on the large button and your partner will stand on the small button, lowering the shield around this Canister.




Canister 9
You can see this Canister on the left, hidden behind the large rock pillar.








Double jump onto the top of the pillar and your weight will lower it, allowing you to collect this Canister. If you are having trouble jumping onto the pillar, you can also get onto the rock platform behind the pillar (at the same level as the True Jedi bar in the screenshot) and hover over to it.




Part 7 - Ben's House

Canister 10
This Canister can be found way in the back of the quicksand field behind Ben's house. Simply hop in a landspeeder and drive to the last little island. You can build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, but it won't lead you to the Canister. Instead, simply double jump carefully up the ledges to reach it.




Minikit Model: Sandcrawler
Through the Jundland Wastes - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Protocol, Sith Force, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - The Jundland Wastes

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is immediately to the left of your starting point.








Blue Canister 2
As you approach the small bridge with the two sand people shooting at you, head to the right instead. The camera will pan to the right, revealing these large silver objects blocking your way. Destroy them to clear the path, then hover across the gap.





Continue down the path and you'll find this Blue Canister on the right, tucked behind some grey boxes.







Blue Canister 3
After collecting Blue Canister 2, continue down the path and you'll find a boarded up cave. Force the orange object next to it to create a platform.







Hop onto the platform and then onto the ledge, where you'll find a Tusken home.








Force the door, allowing you to head inside where this Blue Canister is.








Part 2 - Sandcrawler Approach

Blue Canister 4
After crossing the small patch of quicksand, you'll see this Blue Canister in a small nook. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then grapple up to this Blue Canister.






Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister can be seen in a nook on the Sandcrawler. To reach it, hop on top of the grey-and-orange node, then into the alcove. If you destroy the node, you can also get this by hopping in a Bantha and slowly walking over.





Part 3 - Rescuing R2-D2

Blue Canister 6
When you enter the Sandcrawler, you'll see a pile of LEGO pieces near you. Build them into a Protocol panel, then use it to open the door.







Head inside and head to the left, where you'll find this Blue Canister tucked away by the table and chairs.







Part 4 - Sandcrawler Interior

Blue Canister 7
On the left side of the area are some bars. Sith Force them to destroy them, allowing you to collect this Blue Canister in front of the travel chute.







Part 6 - Return to Jundland

Blue Canister 8
On the left side of the first quicksand fields, you'll find a rock held up by some scaffolding.








Sith Force the scaffolding to destroy it, allowing you to hop up the rocks.








Here you'll find a little oasis, with this Blue Canister way up on the back ledge.








Blue Canister 9
After using the final Protocol panel on the moisture vaporator, the container will fill up with water.








Destroy the container (a Jedi slam works well here) to reveal plants. Force them to reveal LEGO pieces.







Build them into a platform, then use it to hop onto the rock ledge. Hover across the gap to reach this Blue Canister.







Part 7 - Ben's House

Blue Canister 10
This is on top of Ben's house. If you are having trouble getting up here, hop on a Dewback and use the boost to launch yourself onto the roof.
Mos Eisley Spaceport - Story Mode
In search of a pilot who can take them to the distant planet of Alderaan, Luke Skywalker and old Ben Kenobi journey by landspeeder to Mos Eisley Spaceport.

Here, among the most dangerous and reckless elements of Tatooine society, they hope to find someone brave or foolhardy enough to help in their quest to deliver R2-D2's secret message to the Rebel Alliance. But Imperial forces are everywhere....

Enemies: Sandtrooper, Imperial Security Droid, AT-ST
Boss: Imperial Spy
Starting Characters: Luke Skywalker (Tatooine), Ben Kenobi, R2-D2, C-3PO
Added Characters: Han Solo, Chewbacca; Luke Skywalker (Tatooine), Ben Kenobi, R2-D2, C-3PO
True Jedi: 60,000

Part 1 – Mos Eisley Streets

This is a massive area, so take some time to explore it. You will occasionally be hounded by sandtroopers that appear, so stay on your toes and listen for changes in the music that indicate a squad is about to attack. There are also several Mos Eisley residents walking about. Just like in the Cantina, if you kill one, they all start shooting, so stay cautious.

Your goal is to get through the door at the end of the street, which is guarded by a squad of sandtroopers. The sandtroopers will keep appearing, so don’t worry about defeating them. You will notice a large tan staircase to the right of the gate. Force it into a ramp, allowing C-3PO to reach the upper ledge. Once on the upper ledge, head back to the left, then use the Protocol panel to raise the gate, allowing you to continue.

Part 2 – Walker Warfare

Head to the left and continue down the street. You’ll notice your path blocked by some weird barricade. To destroy it, we need some serious firepower. Thankfully, hidden throughout this area are the parts for an AT-ST! Let’s work our way up.

Destroy the two large trashcans to the right of the rubble to reveal the LEGO pieces for the feet. Once those are built, you can Force them into position. The pieces for the left leg can be seen sticking out of the sand in front of the rubble. Force them up and out of the sand, then Force them again to place them on the walker.

Use the Astomech panel to the left of the rubble (hover to give yourself a boost up onto the ledge) to reveal the pieces for the right leg. Force them out of the room, then Force them onto the walker. Build the LEGO pieces out in the open into a support structure, then Force it onto the walker.

Now for the cockpit. Head to the right and destroy the small grey container in front of the Protocol panel. This will reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a ramp, allowing 3PO to reach the Protocol panel next to the door. Use the Protocol panel to open the door, revealing LEGO pieces. Build them into the cockpit, then Force it onto the walker.

Unfortunately, a sandtrooper has decided to steal our ride. Either shoot the walker a bunch of times to force him out, or have Ben use a Jedi mind trick on the walker. Defeat the hijacker, then hop in the walker yourself. Destroy the barricade, then proceed down the streets.

You will encounter a large force of enemy sandtroopers, security droids, and even an AT-ST. It is easier to defeat the enemies if you hop out of your AT-ST, but be careful, as that leaves it vulnerable to hijacking. Once every single enemy has been defeated, the door at the end of the street will open. Head inside.

Part 3 – We Don’t Serve Their Kind!

We’re now inside the cantina, and to open the door into the cantina proper you need to step on the four buttons. Unfortunately, those security cameras will prevent your droids from entering. Have Luke shoot all four cameras, allowing your droids to continue. Step on the buttons to open the door, then head inside.

Part 4 – Chalmun’s Cantina

After that legendary cutscene, you’ll find yourself in control of Han and Chewie. Have fun and start a bar fight if you want. When you’re ready to go, head to the right and through the door with the arrow pointing at it.

Part 5 – Cantina Back Alley

Use the grapple point to the right of the door to reach the next ledge. You’ll notice the Imperial Spy fleeing. While you might be tempted to follow him, build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point and use it to reach the next ledge. Head through the opening in the wall.

Part 6 – Mos Eisley Alleyway

Head to the left along the ledge, then use the grapple point to swing across the gap. You’ll notice the Imperial Spy in the background running towards that large door. Instead of pursuing him, pull the lever to your right to reveal a box. Push it along the tiles and off the ledge. Now you can chase the spy, who will run through the doors and lock them behind him. Time to blow those doors down.

Head back to the box you pushed off the ledge earlier, then push it all the way to the end of the tiles. If at any point you fall down and need to get back up to the ledge with the lever, simply head back down the street and to the right. You’ll see a grapple point on the ground. Use it to reach the first ledge, then head to the right to return to the previous area, where you can grapple back up and head back to the ledge with the lever.

Once the box is locked in place, shoot it to destroy the doors. If you (or a sandtrooper) shoot the box before it’s locked into place, it will explode and you’ll have to grab a new one. Continue through the doors after the spy.

Part 7 – Dewback Stables

As soon as you enter this area, you’ll see the spy magically make his way to the upper ledge on the left. You need to follow him, but first deal with the large squad of sandtroopers. Once they’re all taken care of, hop on one of the dewbacks and walk over to the ledge on the left. Jump off the dewback and use the boost to reach the upper ledge. Once on the ledge, head down the stairs and into the hangar.

Part 8 – Docking Bay 94

You are now reunited with Luke, Ben and the droids. Head towards the Falcon and you will be stopped by the spy, who will call down a wave of sandtroopers. Defeat the first wave and the spy will call in a second wave. Once that wave is also defeated, the spy will call in a third wave. However, he will also now appear on the ground level.

He won’t attack you, but he will be vulnerable to attack for a brief window before retreating to the other side of the hangar. He will repeat this process until he is defeated, and the sandtroopers will keep on coming as long as the spy is alive.

Once you defeat the spy, defeat the remaining sandtroopers and the ramp to the Falcon will lower. Head inside to complete this level.

Unlocked Characters: Han Solo, Sandtrooper (14,000), Greedo (60,000), Imperial Spy (13,500)

You will also unlock Chewbacca if you haven’t already
Mos Eisley Spaceport - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Imperial, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Mos Eisley Streets

Canister 1
Head to the right from your starting point and you'll find an Imperial panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







You're inside a bathhouse, and there are two showers on the left. Force the nozzles to turn them on.







This will drain the pool on the right side of the room, revealing this Canister.








Canister 2
You need to reveal 3 carrots. The first can be found by destroying this trashcan to the right of your starting point.







The second carrot can be found by destroying this trashcan on the left side of the path.








The third carrot can be found by destroying this trashcan by the location of Canister 3.








Once all 3 carrots have been revealed, this Canister will appear high in the air.








To reach it, climb up these stairs on the right side of the street to reach a Double Score Zone.








Head to the left and hover across the gap, then use the Bounty Hunter panel to reveal LEGO pieces back on the ground.







Drop back down and build the LEGO pieces into a fan. Ride the air current up to this Canister.








Canister 3
On the right side of the street, you'll find a set of stairs. Walk up them and Sith Force the hatch on top of the building.







This will reveal a hole in the roof, so drop down inside to collect this Canister.








Red Power Brick (Super lightsabers)
On the left side of the street, you'll find a group of four small trashcans.








Use the Force on each of the four trashcans to remove the lids. Force the trashcans again to extract the LEGO pieces hidden inside.







Build the LEGO pieces into a door and an Astromech panel, then use it to open the door, revealing this Power Brick.







Part 2 - Walker Warfare

Canister 4
You need to get onto this ledge with the LEGO pieces. There are two ways to do this. The easiest way is to get in an AT-ST, walk right up to the ledge, and then simply jump out and onto the ledge. You can also use the Imperial panel in Part 1, which can be found to the right of the Protocol panel above the exit. That will open a door, leading to the ledge to the right of the AT-ST in the screenshot. You can then simply hover over onto the ledge.

Once on the ledge, build the LEGO pieces into turrets.








Hop in a turret and shoot 10 Womp Rats. There is no time limit, so take as long as you need. Once you bullseye 10 Womp Rats, this Canister will appear.






Canister 5
You can find this Canister on a ledge to the right in the area where you construct the AT-ST. Simply Force each of the large grey boxes into a tower, then hop up to the ledge.






Canister 6
Destroy this silver object to reveal LEGO pieces.









Build them into a rotary handle, then turn it to slowly prop up the crashed ship to your right.








Keep turning the rotary handle and eventually some LEGO pieces will appear.








Build them into a grapple point, then use it to grapple up to the ledge with this Canister.








Part 4 - Chalmun's Cantina

Canister 7
Crawl through this travel chute in the back of the cantina to reach this Canister.








Part 5 - Cantina Back Alley

Canister 8
You need to reveal 3 turnips. The first can be found by destroying the trashcan to the left of the cantina exit.
Mos Eisley Spaceport - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 6 - Mos Eisley Alleyway

Canister 8 cont.
To find the second turnip, use the Bounty Hunter panel on the top ledge to open the door. Head inside.







Once inside, drop down and head to the left, where you'll come across these trashcans. Destroy the one to the left of Darth Vader to reveal the second turnip.






Canister 9
After revealing the second turnip, continue to the left and you'll come across this Canister behind some bars.







Force one of the panels and your partner will Force the other. This will raise up one set of bars, allowing you to collect this Canister. It will also release a whole bunch of Womp Rats.






Part 7 - Dewback Stables

Canister 8 cont.
The third and final turnip can be found by destroying the trashcan to the left of the movie theater.







After all 3 turnips have been revealed, this Canister will appear back in Part 6. Simply double jump onto the ledge to reach it.







Canister 10
There is an 8:30 showing of LEGO Star Wars at the movie theater, so let's head inside! Use the Astromech panel to open the door, then head in.







In front of the curtain are four lights. Destroy them all to lift the curtain.








The screen is all messed up, so Force it together.









You can sit and enjoy the movie (which is really the trailer for LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame) if you want. This Canister is hiding behind the screen, so destroy it to reveal this Canister.






Minikit Model: Land Speeder
Mos Eisley Spaceport - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: AStromech, Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Imperial (not required but helpful)

Part 1 - Mos Eisley Streets

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found underneath an arch to the right of your starting point.








Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found underneath an arch on the left side of the path.








Part 2 - Walker Warfare

Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be found on a ledge to the left of your starting point. You can hop in an AT-ST and boost up to this ledge, but there is an easier way to reach this Blue Canister.






Back in Part 1, there is an Imperial panel to the right of the Protocol panel above the exit. Use it to open the door, then head through it, You'll end up right next to this Blue Canister.






Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister can be found to the right of the door to the cantina.








Part 4 - Chalmun's Cantina

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister can be found on top of a table in the back of the cantina.








Part 6 - Mos Eisley Alleyway

Blue Canister 6
There is a Bounty Hunter panel on the top ledge. Use it to open the door, then head inside.








Once in the alley, drop down and head to the left. You'll find this Blue Canister inside an alcove on the right.







Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister can be found on the ground level, by the grapple point that leads back to Part 5.








Part 7 - Dewback Stables

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister can be found in an alcove to the left of the movie theater, surrounded by Dewback dung.







Blue Canister 9
There is an 8:30 showing of LEGO Star Wars in the movie theater. Use the Astromech panel to open the door.







Head inside, where you can find this Blue Canister on the left side of the theater.








Part 8 - Docking Bay 94

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the upper ledge. You can get up here by first hopping on the pipes to the left of the light blue object, then onto the ledge.
Rescue the Princess - Story Mode
Imprisoned in the Death Star, Princess Leia still refuses to reveal the location of the Rebel Base to the evil Darth Vader.

Meanwhile, Luke Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi have commissioned Han Solo to take them to Leia's home planet of Alderaan. Escaping from Imperial forces on Tatooine, they make the jump through hyperspace.

But Alderaan has disappeared, its population a victim of Darth Vader's impatience - and in its place, they find only the deadly shadow of the Death Star....

Enemies: Stormtrooper, Imperial Officer, TIE Fighter Pilot, Death Star Trooper, Beach Trooper, Imperial Shuttle Pilot
Starting Characters: Han Solo (Stormtrooper), Luke Skywalker (Stormtrooper), Chewbacca, Ben Kenobi, R2-D2, C-3PO
True Jedi: 60,000

Part 1 – Death Star Infiltration

Here we are on the Death Star! We have a decent sized party here, but that will soon change. For now, head to the right, where you’ll find your path blocked by a door. Force it into a TIE Fighter model, clearing the way forward.

Head down the hallway, where you’ll be attacked by two stormtroopers. At the end of the hallway, you’ll find a locked door. That Imperial panel will open it, but we don’t have an Imperial character in our party. Thankfully there is a Hat Machine on the wall to the left.

Most non-droid characters can use these, and this particular hat machine gives out stormtrooper helmets. Use the Hat Machine to give someone a stormtrooper helmet (it doesn’t have to be Luke or Han), then use the Imperial panel to open the door.

Keep in mind that you will lose your helmet if you get shot, so be extra cautious while wearing one. If you lose your helmet, you can get it back by returning to a Hat Machine. Also, while wearing a helmet, enemies will not attack you unless you attack them, so use this to your advantage.

Head inside, where you’ll find another locked door. To open this door, build the LEGO pieces on the right of the door into computer panels and an Astromech panel. Use it.

After the cutscene, your party will be reduced to just Luke, Han and Chewie. Ben has gone off to shut down the tractor beam, and the droids are in hiding. The door to the left has now been opened, so head through it.

Part 2 – Splitting Up

Even though Ben is literally running right down the hallway in front of them, of course the stormtroopers will only focus on you. Battle your way down the hallway and you’ll come to a gap you can’t cross. Take a left and head through the door.

Part 3 – Tractor Beam Control

Continue down the hallway. Eventually, you will reach a more open area with two elevators spitting stormtroopers at you. Shoot the cameras to destroy them (they take 4 hits to destroy, and are easier to hit by jumping and shooting), then continue to the left, where you’ll find Old Ben bogged down by enemy fire. Shoot across the gap to take out the enemies.

As thanks, Ben will Force together a bridge for you, allowing you to continue to the left. As you continue, you’ll see a grappling hook on the left side of the path. This will keep sending TIE Pilots in to battle you, so destroy it to cut them off. Shoot the large boxes in the path to set off an explosion, clearing the way ahead.

Continue down the hall and clear the enemies, then backtrack a short distance to the Hat Machine. Grab a stormtrooper helmet, as you’ll need it in the next area. I recommend giving everyone in your party a helmet. That way if you lose yours, you might be able to use someone else’s without having to backtrack. Head back down to the end of the path and through the door on the right.

Part 4 – TIE Pilot Ambush

Head to the right and use the Imperial panel to open the door. Head into the next room. I recommend shooting the grappling hook to prevent the TIE Pilots from shooting your helmet off before you can use the panel.

Part 5 – Ledges and Bridges

Head across the bridge, then build the LEGO pieces onto the rotary handle. Turn it to move the bridge to the right. Cross it to reach the ledge, then use the grapple point to reach the next ledge. While there is a Hat Machine here, I would suggest using it later.

For now, grapple up again, then hop across the short gap to reach the ledge where the two stormtroopers are. Continue to the right and drop down onto the ledge with the door, then head inside the room.

Part 6 – Data Center

In order to leave this room, you need to head through the door on the left. Build the LEGO pieces next to it into an Imperial panel, then use it to open the door. I recommend coming into this room first and clearing out the enemies before heading back into the previous area to grab a helmet.

Once the door is open, head through it and continue down the hallway. You might think you need to use the Imperial panel, but you don’t. You actually need to head into the far left elevator. Simply head inside to travel to the detention block.

Part 7 – Detention Block AA23

We’ve almost found the Princess! Take out the enemies here, as well as the cameras above the two elevators. If you want, you can head into the elevators to reach an area where you can hop in turrets and shoot down TIE Fighters. Shoot down 10 to receive a nice stud reward (20,000). You don’t need to do this, but it is fun.

Back in the main area, build the two piles of LEGO pieces into computer consoles, which will power up the levers. Pull them to open the door into the cell block. Walk down the hallway and pull the levers on the far right cell to open it. Head inside to find the Princess. Step on the buttons to lower the electrical field around her, ending the level.

Unlocked Characters: Han Solo (Stormtrooper), Luke Skywalker (Stormtrooper), Beach Trooper (20,000), Death Star Trooper (19,000), TIE Fighter Pilot (21,000), Imperial Officer (28,000), Grand Moff Tarkin (38,000)
Rescue the Princess - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Protocol, Sith Force, Small

Part 1 - Death Star Infiltration

Canister 1
As you are heading down the first hallway towards the Hat Machine, you will notice a path off to the right. You can see Chewie standing in it in the screenshot.






Head through the opening and you'll find a crane. Hop in, then use it to pick up 10 troopers and drop them into the large hole in the center.







Doing so will reveal this Canister. Use the crane to grab it.








Canister 2
This Canister can be found inside an elevator, which can be found to the right of the windows overlooking the Falcon. Use the Protocol panel to open the elevator.






Part 2 - Splitting Up

Canister 3
During the Story, Ben will run down the hallway and cross this gap. You can't follow him in the Story, but you can now. Hover across the gap and continue down the hallway.






You will notice a door on the left. Head into the little alcove to find this Canister.








Canister 4
After collecting Canister 3, look down the hallway and you'll find this Canister on a ledge.








To reach it, hover across the gap onto the ledge, then grapple up onto the ledge with the travel chute. Crawl through it to reach this Canister.







Canister 5
After collecting Canister 4, continue down the hallway and enter the next room.








Here, you'll find the tractor beam control. Force the bridge, allowing you to cross the gap if you choose to return that way.







Forcing the bridge will reveal three levers.









Pull each of these levers to reveal this Canister up top. Use the grapple point to reach it.








Canister 6
After collecting Canister 5, continue down the hallway and enter the next room. At the end of the hallway, you'll see these bars on the door.







Sith Force them to create platforms, then hop up to this Canister.








Part 3 - Tractor Beam Control

Red Power Brick (Tractor beam)
On the left side of the hallway you take in Story Mode, you'll find an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Once inside, hover across the gap to the left, then use the grapple point to reach this Power Brick.








Part 5 - Ledges and Bridges

Canister 7
Before dropping down to the door and exiting this area, you'll notice this Canister on a ledge to the right. Simply hover over the gap to reach it.







Part 6 - Data Center

Canister 8
All throughout the first room in this area are computer consoles. Shoot and destroy each and every one of them to reveal this Canister.







The Canister will appear by the Imperial panel you use to open the door.








Canister 9
Just to the left of the elevator to the detention block, you'll notice three boxes. Force them into a tower, then hop on top of it and onto the ledge.







Push this object to the right into the red panel.









This will cause it to crash down, destroying the cage around this Canister.








Part 7 - Detention Block AA23

Canister 10
Head all the way down the detention block hallway and you'll see some droid panels.








Use the Protocol panel on the left to open the cell. Inside, you'll find this Canister.








Minikit Model: Millenium Falcon
Rescue the Princess - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Hover, Protocol

Part 1 - Death Star Infiltration

Blue Canister 1
As you head down the first hallway, you'll notice a path you can take to the right.








Head inside and you'll find this Blue Canister next to the crane.








Blue Canister 2
There is a Protocol panel to the right of the windows overlooking the Falcon. Use it to open the elevator with this Blue Canister inside.







Part 2 - Splitting Up

Blue Canister 3
When you follow Ben down the hallway in the Story, he will jump across this gap. Now we can follow him! Hover across this gap, then continue down the hallway.






Keep going down the hallway until you reach the tractor beam control, where you'll find this Blue Canister to the left of the bridge pieces.







Blue Canister 4
This one is tricky. After collecting Blue Canister 3, continue to the left down the hallway. You can find this Blue Canister trapped inside one of the orange-and-grey half cylinders.






Destroy it and you will reveal this Blue Canister.









Part 3 - Tractor Beam Control

Blue Canister 5
Before you reach the large gap across from the tractor beam control, you will find this Blue Canister just floating in the air. Double jump up to reach it.







Blue Canister 6
After collecting Blue Canister 5, head inside the nearby elevator. Use the Astromech panel to go up.








As soon as you exit the elevator, you'll see this Blue Canister in the center of the room.








Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is just chilling at the end of the hallway.








Part 6 - Data Center

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is floating above the weird object in the center of the first room.








Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister is up on a ledge to the left of the elevator to the detention block. To reach it, Force the boxes into a tower, then hop up onto the ledge.







Part 7 - Detention Block AA23

Blue Canister 10
Pull the first set of levers on the left to open the cell, where inside is this Blue Canister.
Death Star Escape - Story Mode
Luke Skywalker, Han Solo and Chewbacca have rescued Princess Leia from the clutches of Darth Vader and his Imperial forces - but must now find a way out of the Death Star.

Aided by the droid R2-D2, who can interface remotely with the Death Star control systems, they battle their way to the Millennium Falcon.

Meanwhile, the Jedi Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi moves closer to his final destiny....

Enemies: Stormtrooper, Imperial Officer, TIE Fighter Pilot, Death Star Trooper
Starting Characters: Han Solo, Luke Skywalker (Tatooine), Chewbacca, Princess Leia
Added Characters: R2-D2, C-3PO
True Jedi: 45,000

Part 1 – The Trash Compactor

With the droids having saved us, it’s time to leave the compactor. Build the LEGO pieces into a platform, then hop on and pull the lever to open the door. Exit the trash compactor and continue down the hallway through the door. You’ll notice a Hat Machine on the left side of the hallway. Ignore it for now and continue down the hallway, defeating the enemies as you go. Head through the opening into the next room.

Part 2 – Small Hangar

The first thing I recommend doing here is jumping down and defeating the squad of stormtroopers in this room. After doing so, you can focus on getting out of here. The way out is that door in the back with the Imperial panel next to it. Unfortunately, there is no way to access it. Let’s fix that.

Begin by heading to the left on the ground floor. You’ll notice a rotary handle and some yellow-and-grey stripes. Push the tall object on the left onto the red button by the rotary handle. This will allow you to turn the rotary handle, so do so to raise up the platform.

Now head back to the right and grapple back onto the ledge. Pull the lever three times to place the grapple point in position, then use it to swing across the gap and land on the platform you raised. Hop onto the ledge, then pull the lever to reveal a box. Push it to the end of the tiles and off the ledge.

This will destroy the panel in the floor, allowing you to hop on the small speeder. Hop in and ride the speeder over the five red buttons on the floor in quick succession. This will extend a panel under the door. Head back to the first area and use the Hat Machine to grab a helmet, then head back here and grapple across the gap to reach the Imperial panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.

Part 3 – Death Star Hallway

Head to the right down the hallway. You’ll find a locked door. Build the LEGO pieces onto the wall, powering up the lever. Pull it to power the lever, then pull it to open the door. Pull the next set of levers to open the next door. Push the box along the tiles into the slot on the wall to power up the final lever. Pull it to open the door. Continue down the hallway.

Part 4 – Helmet Hijinks

Head to the right and pull the levers to start a platform moving. Hop on it and use it to cross the gap, then continue to the right. There are a series of platforms here, and you need to get to the top one. To do so, use the grapple point to reach the first ledge. Pull the lever to drop some LEGO pieces onto the ground floor. Drop back down and build the LEGO pieces onto the generator.

This will start raising and lowering the lift. Hop on and ride it up. The exit to this area is on the upper level, where you’ll find an Imperial panel. There is a Hat Machine on one of the ledges on the left if you need a helmet.

The problem in this area is the fact that the stormtroopers will constantly be harassing you, meaning that getting to the Imperial panel with a helmet on can be difficult. However, there will be periods where you will not be harassed by enemies. Use this window to reach the panel. Once you get to the Imperial panel, use it to open the door. Head on inside.

Part 5 – Small Hallway

Head down the hallway and through the door at the end.

Part 6 – Grappling Fun

Looks like we took a wrong turn. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then use it to swing across the gap. Through the door on this ledge, you’ll find a Hat Machine if you need a helmet. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then use it to swing across the gap. Use the Imperial panel to open the door, then head inside.

Part 7 – Bait and Switch

What is that? Just a lone stormtrooper? Let’s get him! He will run through a blast door, which will then shut behind him. Shoot the panel on the right of the door to open it, then continue pursuing the stormtrooper. He will run behind another closed blast door, so shoot the next panel to open the door. He will then run behind another door, so shoot the wall panel to open that door and you’ll find, well, way more than one stormtrooper.

Defeat the large horde of enemies, then build the LEGO pieces in the back of the room into a door. Building this can be difficult, as the stormtroopers will keep coming. You can pull the levers on the side of the room to temporarily shut the doors and give you some peace. Once you build the door, shoot it to reveal an opening in the wall. Continue down the hallway.

Part 8 – Ben’s Sacrifice

Well, we’re in the hangar, where the Millennium Falcon is trapped under a shield. You’ll notice a panel above the Falcon with four red lights on it. You need to turn them all green. The first order of business is to rescue the droids. They can be found on the right side of the hangar. Build the pile of LEGO pieces into a handle, then push it to reveal the droids, adding them to your party.

With R2 and 3PO, you can now work on freeing the Falcon. On the right side of the Falcon is an Astromech panel. Use it to turn one of the lights green. This will also unleash a new wave of stormtroopers (turning each light green will send another wave in). To the right of the Astromech panel is a blue box. Push it to the right to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point, then use it to reach the upper ledge. Pull the lever to turn another light green.

Head back to the left side of the hangar and use the Astromech panel to reveal a small speeder. Just like in Part 2, hop in and drive it over the five red buttons in front of the Falcon in quick succession to turn another light green.

For the final light, pull the lever to the left of the Falcon to destroy the vent, releasing steam. Head into the steam as 3PO to be boosted onto the ledge, where you can use the Protocol panel to turn the final light green. Once the Falcon is out of the shield, defeat the remaining stormtroopers to lower the Falcon’s boarding ramp. Head inside to complete the level.
Death Star Escape - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - The Trash Compactor

Red Power Brick (Invincibility)
As soon as you exit the trash compactor, you'll find a Protocol panel on the left side of the hallway. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Inside, you'll find some LEGO pieces.









Build the pile on the left into a refrigerator.









Force it to open it up, revealing this Power Brick.









Canister 1
There is a silver panel on the wall by the Hat Machine.








Destroy it to reveal this Canister.









Part 2 - Small Hangar

Canister 2
You can see this Canister underneath the floor. Crawl through the travel chute by the small speeder to reach it.







Part 3 - Death Star Hallway

Canister 3
Just to the right of your starting point, you'll notice a pair of stormtroopers cleaning the window. You'll also notice a crane. Hop in the crane and use it to move the stormtroopers around, cleaning the window in the process.





Once the window is clean, the stormtroopers will stand like this. When they stand like this, hop out of the crane. The window will explode (shame, we just cleaned it), revealing this Canister.






Canister 4
On the right side of the hallway, you'll notice some bars covering an opening.








Sith Force them to destroy them, allowing you to collect this Canister.








Part 4 - Helmet Hijinks

Canister 5
You'll find this Canister trapped behind LEGO pieces hanging above the Imperial panel.








Force the LEGO pieces to create a platform, allowing you to double jump up to this Canister.








Part 7 - Bait and Switch

Canister 6
As soon as you enter this area, head towards the screen to run back down the hallway. Eventually the hallway will end, so be careful not to fall down! You'll see this Canister on a platform on the left. Carefully jump over to it.





Canister 7
As you are chasing the stormtrooper down the hallway, you'll notice these large orange-and-grey half cylinders on the wall.







Destroy the first 3 to reveal these little boxes with a grape on them (in the handheld version of this game, these are called Fruit Pickups).







Once you reveal all 3, this Canister will appear.









Canister 8
This Canister can be found on a ledge in the room where you are overwhelmed by stormtroopers.








To reach it, Force the nearby grey boxes into a tower, allowing you to reach the ledge.








Part 8 - Ben's Sacrifice

Canister 9
This Canister can be found in the room where Vader and Ben fight. Use the Bounty Hunter panel to open the door inside.







Canister 10
This Canister is hiding in plain sight in the room where you find R2 and 3PO.








Minikit Model: Y-wing
Death Star Escape - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Grapple, Protocol

Part 1 - The Trash Compactor

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is very easy to miss. It's barely visible underneath the murky water of the trash compactor. It can be found just to the right of the metal pole jutting out of the water. Head towards the screen when the level starts and you should run into it.




Blue Canister 2
After exiting the trash compactor, you'll notice a Protocol panel in the hallway. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







You'll find this Blue Canister on the right side of the room.








Part 2 - Small Hangar

Blue Canister 3
You'll find this Blue Canister on a small ledge. To reach it, pull the lever twice. This will move a grapple point into position, allowing you to grapple up to this Blue Canister.






Part 3 - Death Star Hallway

Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is plainly visible to the left of your starting point.








Part 4 - Helmet Hijinks

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is also in plain sight as you enter this area.








Part 5 - Small Hallway

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the hallway.








Part 6 - Grappling Fun

Blue Canister 7
After grappling across the first gap, head through the door to find this Blue Canister in front of the Hat Machine.







Part 7 - Bait and Switch

Blue Canister 8
In the room where you are overwhelmed by stormtroopers, there are two doorways where the troopers come from. Head inside the door on the left to find this Blue Canister.






Blue Canister 9
Similar to the previous Blue Canister, this Blue Canister is in the door on the right.








Part 8 - Ben's Sacrifice

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found to the right of the Astromech panel on the right side of the Falcon.
Rebel Attack - Story Mode
With the Death Star plans in their hands at last, the Rebel Alliance plans a desperate assault on the Imperial space station.

But a hidden homing beacon attached to the Millennium Falcon has led Darth Vader to the Rebel's secret base on the moon of Yavin IV.

The moon will soon be in the range of the mighty Death Star's superlaser. Now, a small band of fearless pilots bear with them the hopes of an entire galaxy....

Enemies: TIE Fighter
Starting Vehicles: X-wing
True Jedi: 30,000

Part 1 – Death Star Assault

You can’t fly around too much because you are boxed in by a shield. Flying close to the shield will reveal a torpedo target. Grab a torpedo from the nearby torpedo generator, then use it to destroy the target. This will lower the shield, allowing you to fly into the larger clearing.

Head into the clearing and you’ll notice your path is once again blocked by a shield. There are a bunch of red lines leading away from the shield. Follow the lines and you’ll reveal four torpedo targets. Grab torpedoes and destroy the targets to lower the shield, then blast your way through the barrier and continue on.

Part 2 – Death Star Surface

This part is the same as the first, just in a larger area. Follow the red lines away from the shield to find 8 torpedo targets. Destroy them to lower the shield, then shoot and destroy the barrier, allowing you to continue.

Part 3 – Death Star Turrets

This section is identical to the previous two. Destroy the torpedo targets to lower the shield, then destroy the barrier. Fly towards the trench to begin your trench run!

Part 4 – The Trench Run

After the cutscene, you’ll find yourself being chased by Vader and two TIEs. If you turn around and fire on the escorts, you can actually score hits on them and eventually destroy them. You can’t destroy Vader though. You’ll be given one torpedo as you enter the trench, so avoid the fire from the TIE Fighters until you reach the end of the trench. Once you reach the end of the trench, a cutscene will play.

After the cutscene, you’ll find yourself at the exhaust port. Before you can destroy it, you need to destroy the defenses. There are 12 turrets that will appear when you fly close to them. Expose and destroy the turrets and the final torpedo target will appear. If you need a torpedo, a generator can be found at the beginning of the trench. Destroy the torpedo target to destroy the Death Star and complete the level.

Unlocked Vehicles: Y-wing, TIE Fighter (35,000), TIE Interceptor (40,000), TIE Fighter (Darth Vader) (50,000)

You will also unlock the X-wing if you haven't already
Rebel Attack - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: TIE, Tow Cable

Part 1 - Death Star Assault

Canister 1
After you fly past the first shield, you'll notice a "+" looking shape on the left side of the Death Star's surface.







Fly close to it to reveal a large rotary handle.









Shoot it a couple of times to reveal a cage, then destroy it to receive this Canister.








Canister 2
To the left of the second shield is a TIE Gate. Fly up to it as a TIE Fighter to open it.








Inside you'll find a torpedo target. Destroy it to reveal the cage with this Canister inside. Shoot it to collect it.







Canister 3
On the right side of the area, you'll find a series of four blue rectangular panels. Destroy them to reveal an alcove with a cage inside. Destroy the cage to receive this Canister.






Part 2 - Death Star Surface

Canister 4
On the right side of the area is a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it. Here, you'll see this Canister inside a cage, which is behind a shield. You'll have to shut off the shield to collect the Canister.





Head back down the Death Star's surface and you'll find a smaller TIE Gate. Open it and you'll reveal a bomb dispenser.







Latch onto a bomb (both of the TIE Gates will stay open for you) and drag it back into the orange panels on each side of the shield. You'll need two bombs, one for each side. Destroy the orange panels to lower the shield around this Canister, allowing you to collect it.




Canister 5
Destroy these four blue rectangular panels by the TIE Gate on the right side of the area to reveal an alcove with a cage inside. Destroy the cage to receive this Canister.






Canister 6
There is a "+" shape by the TIE Gate on the left of the area. Fly near it to reveal a large rotary handle, then shoot it to reveal a cage. Destroy it to receive this Canister.






Canister 7
There is a TIE Gate on the left side of the area. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it.








Inside you'll find a series of green lights. Fly over them in quick succession to reveal the cage with this Canister inside.







Part 3 - Death Star Turrets

Canister 8
There is a "+" shape on the left side of the area. Fly near it to reveal a large rotary handle, then shoot it to reveal a cage. Destroy it to receive this Canister.







Canister 9
