You’ll find the turret on the right, but with no way to reach it. You’ll notice four ladder-like objects on the right side of the deck. Each of them is held down by a clasp. Destroy the clasps, then Force the ladders to create a ramp. Walk up it to the turret.

Part 5 – Turret

Use the Astromech panel to charge up the turret, then hop inside. Shoot the two targets to destroy the barge and end the level. You do have a limited number of shots in the turret before it runs out of charge. If you run out, simply use the Astromech panel again to recharge it.

Unlocked Characters: Lando (Palace Guard), Princess Leia (Slave), Skiff Guard (12,000), Boba Fett (100,000)
The Great Pit of Carkoon - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Skiff Hopping

Canister 1
There are 4 turrets for you to build. Destroy these two boxes on the first skiff to reveal LEGO pieces.








Force one set of LEGO pieces into a turret, then build the other pile of LEGO pieces into a second turret.







The next two turrets can be found on the second skiff. Pull this lever to reveal a box.








Push the box into one of the slots on the skiff to reveal LEGO pieces for a turret. You'll have to pull the lever twice to reveal two boxes. Once the boxes are in place, destroy them to reveal the LEGO pieces for the third and fourth turret.





Once all 4 turrets are built, this Canister will appear in the air. To reach it, Force the pile of LEGO pieces into a tower.







Hop up the platforms on the tower to reach this Canister.








Canister 2
The second skiff has a plank on it. This Canister can be found at the end of it.








Canister 3
Before hopping across the platform to the barge, Sith Force the other set of LEGO pieces to create another platform, this one leading to the right.







Hop onto it, then onto the front of the sail barge.









Continue to the right and you'll find a grapple point.









Grapple up and you'll see a lever.









Shoot the panel on the wall to the left of the lever to reveal the LEGO pieces for this Canister.








Canister 4
After collecting Canister 3, drop down and continue to the right. You'll find this Canister up in an alcove. You can Force the panels under it, but they will all explode, so you can't reach this Canister that way.






If you look along the ledge where the Canister is, you'll see three gates. You need to raise them to reach the Canister. Force the panels on this side of the barge to reveal two Protocol panels and an Astromech panel. Use each of the panels to raise the gates on the ledge.




Once all the gates are raised, head back to the left and use this grapple point to reach the ledge.








Head to the right and you'll find the path blocked by a silver object (although it looks black, it's actually silver). Destroy it and you'll be able to collect this Canister.






Canister 5
To the left of the exit you'll find a box. Destroy it to reveal the LEGO pieces for a grapple point.








Build the grapple point, then use it to reach the upper ledge, where you'll find three levers.








Sith Force the one on the left and your partner will pull the other two, revealing this Canister.








Part 2 - Weapons Storage

Canister 6
There are two travel chutes in this area, one on the left and one on the right.








Use either one of them to reach the room behind the glass.








Pull one of the levers and your partner will pull the other, revealing this Canister.








Part 3 - Party Suite

Canister 7
Before heading up the stairs to the barge's deck, you'll find yourself in a room with window coverings.








Destroy the window coverings on the left side of the room to reveal the LEGO pieces for this Canister.
The Great Pit of Carkoon - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 4 - Barge Main Deck

Canister 8
There is a box to the left of your starting point.









Force it to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then hover across the gap to the next ledge. Use the grapple point to reach the ledge with this Canister on it.







Canister 9
You'll find this Canister hiding underneath the first part of the deck. To access it, you'll have to be very careful. When you are in the deck turret, be careful and only destroy one of the targets.






After destroying one and only one of the targets (it doesn't matter which one), return to the spot where the target was and you'll find a hole. Drop down into the tunnel, where you can find this Canister.






Red Power Brick (Bounty hunter rockets)
On the second level of the barge, there is a box.









Destroy it to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then hover to the left to land on another ledge. You'll see this Power Brick on the left, so hover over to it.







Canister 10
This Canister is inside an alcove underneath the deck turret. Crawl through either of the travel chutes to reach it.







Minikit Model: Sail Barge
The Great Pit of Carkoon - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Grapple, Hover (not required but helpful), Sith Force, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Skiff Hopping

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the skiff where you fight Boba Fett.








Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be seen on the far right side of the barge. To reach it, Sith Force the LEGO pieces on the side of the barge into a platform, then hop onto the barge.






Blue Canister 3
After collecting Blue Canister 2, continue along the barge, then grapple up and pull this lever to extend a platform near this Blue Canister.







With that platform extended, you can now hover over to this Blue Canister, as well as reach the other side of the barge.







Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the barge, hidden behind a panel.








Force it to raise it up and destroy it, revealing this Blue Canister.








Part 2 - Weapons Storage

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is hiding in plain sight on the right side of the room.








Part 3 - Party Suite

Blue Canister 6
As soon as you enter this area, you'll see a silver object on the left. Destroy it to reveal an opening.








Head inside the room to find this Blue Canister.









Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the ledge with the box.








Part 4 - Barge Main Deck

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is to the left of your starting point.








Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister is to the left of the top target.









Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is in the bottom left corner of the upper level of the deck.
Speeder Showdown - Story Mode
The Rebel Alliance has learned of the new Death Star, and launches a daring plan to destroy this evil weapon before its construction can be completed.

The Rebel fleet is readied for an assault, and a small strike unit lands on the nearby forest moon of Endor.

Led by Luke Skywalker and Han Solo, their mission is to destroy the shield generator which protects the deadly Imperial space station....

Enemies: Scout Trooper, Stormtrooper
Starting Characters: Princess Leia (Endor), Luke Skywalker (Endor)
True Jedi: 55,000

Part 1 – Endor Forest

We need to get into that clearing. Start by destroying the plants in front of you to reveal LEGO pieces. Force them into a platform, then stand on it as Leia. Luke will Force you up, so hop over the log. Destroy the plant to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a grapple point.

Grapple onto the ledge, then head back and hop onto the wooden platform. This will raise up some platforms, allowing Luke to join you. Force the wood into a ramp, then walk up and over the log into the clearing.

Part 2 – Landing Pad Shield

Head to the right and two scout troopers on speeder bikes will appear. Hop on the bikes and you will start rocketing through the forest.

Part 3 – Speeder Path

Your objective is to take out the two speeder bikes. Get behind them and shoot them down. Sometimes they will do a loop and get behind you. When this happens, simply hit the “jump” button (make sure your directional input is forward or you'll just do a roll) and you’ll do a loop and get back behind them. Once you do so, you will stop and land in a clearing.

Part 4 – First Shield Generator

Your objective in these clearings is to destroy the large rotating white structure. To do so you need an AT-ST. Fortunately, one is provided for you. Either shoot or mind trick the driver out of the AT-ST, then use it to destroy the white structure. This will destroy one of the nodes on the shield protecting the landing pad. Once the structure is destroyed, hop back in your speeder.

Part 3 – Speeder Path

Just like the last time, you need to destroy some speeder bikes. This time, there are three. Once they’re toast, you’ll stop in another clearing.

Part 5 – Second Shield Generator

The idea in this clearing is the same: destroy the white structure. However, there is not an AT-ST here. You’ll have to build it yourself.

Head to the left and destroy the plants to reveal the feet, then head towards the screen to find a wooden box. Force it against the ledge, then double jump onto it. Force the other box into position, allowing Leia to join you. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then grapple up and pull the lever. This will drop the rest of the pieces for an AT-ST.

Drop back down and Force it together, then hop in and destroy the white structure. Once that’s toast, hop back in your speeder.

Part 3 – Speeder Path

By now you know the drill. Destroy four speeder bikes to stop in the next clearing.

Part 6 – Third Shield Generator

This area has provided the AT-ST, so kick the driver out and destroy the white structure. Hop back in your speeder.

Part 3 – Speeder Path

One more to go. Destroy five speeders and you’ll stop in a clearing.

Part 2 – Bunker Shield

You are now back where you started, but there is no AT-ST for you. You’ll have to build another one. Head towards the screen to find a small bridge. Cross it, then destroy the plants to reveal the feet for the walker and LEGO pieces. Build the LEGO pieces into a rotary handle, then turn it to lower the cage around the walker parts.

Force together the AT-ST, then use it to shoot the two hanging cages. This will reveal some LEGO pieces, so Force them into a bridge. This will allow the AT-ST to reach the main area. Head over to the white structure and destroy it.

With all the structures destroyed, the shield on the right side of the area will now be lowered. Continue past it towards the landing pad.

Part 7 – Landing Pad Exterior

Head towards the bunker. On the right side are two levers. Pull them to lower the elevator, then head inside.

Part 8 – Landing Pad Catwalk

Simply head to the left and step into the elevator at the end.

Part 9 – Landing Pad

There will be an AT-AT firing randomly, so be careful. There are also grapple hooks that are calling in stormtroopers. Destroy them to cut off the reinforcements, which will give you some peace apart from the walker. Pull the four levers to lower the shields around the rotating disks.

Once all four shields are down, step on the white panel on the top part of the landing pad to be launched into the AT-AT. This will put you in control of it, so slowly rotate around and destroy the four dishes. Once all four are destroyed, hop out of the AT-AT. Two levers will then appear. Pull them to end this long level.

Unlocked Characters: Princess Leia (Endor), Luke Skywalker (Endor)
Speeder Showdown - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Imperial, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 3 - Speeder Path

Canister 1
Fly over a button to lower a ramp, which will launch you into the cage with this Canister inside.








Canister 2
Fly over a series of three buttons on the ground.









This will lower a cage with this Canister inside.









Canister 3
Fly over two buttons to raise a ramp.









Ride the ramp up to the ledge, where you'll find a cage with this Canister inside.








Canister 4
Fly over four buttons to lower a cage with this Canister inside.








Canister 5
Fly over a button to raise a ramp.









Ride it onto the ledge, then fly over the next three buttons.








This will raise a ramp. Ride it to crash through the cage with this Canister inside.








Canister 6
This Canister is simply in a cage on the right side of the path.








Part 4 - First Shield Generator

Canister 7
Drive the AT-ST over to the ledge on the right, then hop out onto the ledge.








Sith Force the plants to reveal a travel chute.









Crawl through it to reach the upper ledge, then hover to the left. Pull the lever to lower the cage with this Canister.







Part 5 - Second Shield Generator

Canister 8
On the right side of the clearing, you'll find a pile of LEGO pieces. Build them into a platform, then use it to hop onto the ledge.







Destroy the two silver boxes to reveal wooden boxes.








Force all three of the wooden boxes into a tower, then hop up them and onto the ledge. Pull the lever to lower the cage with this Canister inside.







Part 6 - Third Shield Generator

Canister 9
On the right side of the clearing, you'll find a pile of LEGO pieces.








Build them into a wooden box, then use it to reach the ledge.








Destroy the silver box to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point, then Force the platform on the right.







Use the grapple point to grapple up to the ledge, then pull the lever to lower the cage with this Canister.







Part 7 - Landing Pad Exterior

Red Power Brick (Score x8)
This Red Power Brick can be found on a catwalk on the left side of the landing pad. To reach it, push the travel chute along the tiles into the slot on the landing pad, then crawl through it to reach this.






Part 8 - Landing Pad Catwalk

Canister 10
This Canister can be found inside a silver cage in Part 7.








To collect it, use the Imperial panel on the catwalk to lower the cage to the ground, allowing you to destroy it and collect this Canister.







Minikit Model: TIE Bomber
Speeder Showdown - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Grapple

Part 1 - Endor Forest

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found to the left of your starting point.








Part 2 - Landing Pad Shield

Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found in the bottom left corner of the clearing, near the wood bridge.








Part 3 - Speeder Path

Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the path by a ramp (it's right next to the 18 in the screenshot).








Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the path near a dish turret.








Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is towards the center of the path.








Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the path.









Part 4 - First Shield Generator

Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister can be found hiding with the plants on the ledge on the right side of the clearing. Hop in the AT-ST, then hop out onto the ledge.







Part 5 - Second Shield Generator

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the clearing near the plants.








Part 6 - Third Shield Generator

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found in the bottom left corner of the clearing.








Part 7 - Landing Pad Exterior

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found in a catwalk on the landing pad. Build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, then grapple up to reach this.
The Battle of Endor - Story Mode
As the Rebel fleet draws closer to the Death Star, Luke Skywalker has turned himself over to Imperial forces and heads to the Death Star for a final confrontation with Darth Vader. The commando team led by Han Solo makes its way towards the Imperial shield generator on Endor.

But the Rebel forces are lured into a trap. Although it appears incomplete, the Death Star is already fully functional.

And a deadly surprise lies in wait for the intrepid Rebel strike team....

Enemies: Stormtrooper, Scout Trooper, Imperial Officer
Starting Characters: Han Solo (Endor), Princess Leia (Endor), Chewbacca, C-3PO, R2-D2, Wicket
True Jedi: 90,000

Part 1 – Bright Tree Village

With the Ewoks having accepted us into the tribe, we can now make our way to the shield generator. Head to the right and you’ll find a travel chute. Have Wicket crawl through it, then build the two piles of LEGO pieces into gears. This will raise up the bridge, allowing the rest of the party to join you.

Continue to the right and you’ll find your path cut off again. Destroy the boards in front of the Protocol panel, then use it to reveal some LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point, then use it to grapple up onto the ledge. Pull the lever to raise the bridge, allowing you to continue. Drop down and continue to the right, then head down the stairs.

Part 2 – Forest Descent

Head to the right and you’ll find a large lift. This will bring us down to the forest floor, but first you have to power it up. There are also four grappling hooks here bringing in stormtroopers and scout troopers, so destroy those to give you some peace.

With the enemies taken care of, destroy all of the objects on the tiles. Build the LEGO pieces left behind into a generator, then push it into the slot on the left side of the tiles. Once the generator is in place, crawl through the travel chute and pull the lever.

This will lower the hook, carrying the generator to the top ledge. Push it into the slot to raise up the lift. Step on one of the buttons and your partners will step on the others, lowering you to the forest floor.

Part 3 – Forest Floor

Head to the right and you’ll see a travel chute that is too high up to reach. To fix that, destroy the plants to the left of it to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a rotary handle, then turn it to raise the platform under the travel chute. With the platform in place, hop on it and crawl through the travel chute. Step on the button to reveal a grapple point. Stay on the button and one of your partners will grapple up and pull the lever, lowering the gate and raising the ramp.

Continue up the ramp to the right, then cross the small stream. You’ll run into another clearing with two gates at the end. To lower them, destroy the tan panel in between the two gates to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a Protocol panel, then use it to lower the first set of gates. Step on one of the buttons and your partners will stand on the other, lowering the next gates.

Head to the right set of gates and build the LEGO pieces into a ramp. This will allow the droids to access the two buttons. Head to the left set of gates and crawl through the travel chute. Pull the lever to drop a box, revealing LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point, allowing Han, Leia and Chewie to reach the buttons.

Step on one of the buttons (Han, Leia, Chewie and Wicket on the left; R2 and 3PO on the right) and your partners will stand on the other. Stepping on all six buttons will lower the gates. Continue to the right into the forest.

Part 4 – Bunker Battle

Head to the right and you’ll find your path blocked by a large barrier. Hop in the catapult and fire a few rocks at the barrier to destroy it, then continue along the path. You’ll be attacked by an AT-ST, so force the driver out and hijack the walker. Use it to destroy the barrier farther down the path, allowing you to continue into the clearing in front of the bunker.

Stay in the AT-ST and use it to destroy the barriers to the left of the bunker. Hop out of the AT-ST and onto the first platform, then step on the button to reveal a grapple point. Stay on the button and your partner will grapple up onto the ledge and pull the lever, revealing LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point, then use it to reach the platform.

Use the next grapple point to reach the top of the bunker. Destroy the hatches to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into tiles. Push the object off the roof of the bunker to reveal LEGO pieces. Drop down and build them into an Astromech panel. Unfortunately, R2 can’t get up here yet.

Drop down off the ledge the bunker is on, then build the LEGO pieces into a ramp, allowing R2 to reach the panel. Use the Astromech panel to open the door, then head inside.

Part 5 – Bunker Interior

Head to the right and down the slope. Shoot the panel on the door a few times to open it, then head into the main room. The objective here is to shut off the shield so we can plant bombs in the reactor. Pull the lever on the left. This will shut off one of the power sources. There are three more to shut off.

Shoot the panel on the door on the left a few times to open it, then head inside. You need to get 3PO onto the upper ledge, and to do it you’ll need to construct a ramp. Step on the button on the left to extend one platform. Destroy the wall panels to the left of the TIE Interceptor model you can build to reveal another button. Step on it to extend the second platform. Destroy the grey node to the right of the TIE Interceptor model you can build to reveal another button. Step on it to extend the third platform.

Once all three platforms are extended, hop up them to reach the upper ledge. Destroy the wall panels to reveal a small generator. Push it into the slot on the left to turn the platforms into a ramp, allowing 3PO to reach the upper ledge. Use the Protocol panel to lower the shields around the purple lever, then pull it to shut off another power source.

Head back into the main room, then head to the right. Shoot the panel on the door a few times to open it, then continue into the room. Use the Astromech panel to power a lift. Catch a ride onto the upper ledge, then head left. Hover across the gap to reach another ledge, then use the Astromech panel to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a travel chute, then use it to reach the room with the lever. Pull it to shut off one of the power sources.

Crawl back through the travel chute, then ride the lift back up to the ledge. Hop across the gap to the right, then build the LEGO pieces into a small bridge, allowing 3PO to cross. Use the Protocol panel to lower the shield around the lever, then pull it to shut off the final power source.

Once all four power sources have been shut off, two levers will appear in the main room. Pull them to shut off the shields, then head inside the reactor and build the four piles of LEGO pieces into bombs to complete the level.

Unlocked Characters: Han Solo (Endor), Wicket, Ewok (34,000)
The Battle of Endor - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Bright Tree Village

Canister 1
To the left of your starting point are two purple boxes. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces.








Build them into a rotary handle, then turn it.









This will straighten out the platform across the gap, allowing you to hover onto it.








Once you land on the platform, you will be raised up onto the ledge with this Canister.








Canister 2
You'll find this Canister behind some wooden bars after the first bridge.








Step into the lift on the right to be raised up to the ledge, then pull the lever.








This will straighten out the platform underneath the lever. Hover across the gap to land on the ledge below the rock.







Force the rock to lower the platform, then quickly jump onto it. The platform will rise back up the lever, so pull it to lower the bars around this Canister.






Canister 3
On the platform with the lever that raises the second bridge, you'll find a wooden platform you can Force. Force it to lower it, then hop onto it and onto the next platform on the right.






Force the platform again to raise it back up, allowing you to hop onto the platform with this Canister.







Part 3 - Forest Floor

Canister 4
In the bottom left corner of the first clearing are two purple boxes. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces.








Build them into a grapple point, then use it to reach the upper platform.








You'll find this Canister behind the bars on the entrance to the hut. Destroy them to allow you access to this Canister.







Canister 5
Head upstream and you'll find this Canister. If you try to walk up to it however, you'll slide back down. You'll need to find another way to head upstream.







On the right side of the clearing after the stream are a bunch of boxes and plants. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces that you can build into a tractor.






Hop onto the tractor and ride it into the stream. The tractor will drive right up the slope, allowing you to reach this Canister.







Canister 6
There is a small bundle of plants to the left of the exit. Destroy them to reveal a travel chute.








Crawl through it to reach the upper ledge, then hover to the right to reach the ledge with this Canister on it.







Part 4 - Bunker Battle

Canister 7
On the right side of the bunker, you'll find two silver boxes. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a platform.







Stand on the platform, then Force the rock to lift the platform up. Quickly crawl through the travel chute to reach the upper ledge. Take too long and the platform will lower back down.






Force the wooden platform down, then hop across it and onto the next platform on the left.








Force the wooden platform back up, allowing you to hop onto the ledge with this Canister.








Canister 8
On the left side of the clearing, you'll find some purple boxes. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a rotary handle.







Turn the rotary handle to straighten out the platform above you, then destroy the plant on the left to reveal a grapple point.







Use the grapple point to land on the platform, then Force the rock to raise it up.








Quickly hover to the left to land on the next platform.








Force the rock to raise that platform up, then hover towards the screen to land on another platform. Jump over to the platform with this Canister on it.
The Battle of Endor - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 5 - Bunker Interior

Red Power Brick (Super Ewok catapult)
In the left room of the bunker, you'll find a set of tiles on the right side of the room. Destroy the panel in the wall to create an opening into the next room.







Sith Force the panel in the floor to reveal a generator, then push it along the tiles and into the next room.







We now need to get into the room, so hover to the right across the gap by the lever to reach the opposite ledge.







Use the Protocol panel to drop a bomb on the stormtrooper inside, killing him and revealing a travel chute below.







Drop back down and crawl through the travel chute to enter the room, then push the generator along the tiles into the slot in the back. This will lower the shield around the Power Brick.






Canister 9
In the right room of the bunker, you'll find a series of panels on the wall.








Destroy the ones on the right to reveal hatches.









Force each of them to reveal the LEGO pieces for this Canister.








Canister 10
This Canister can be found in the background by the lever you reach by crawling through the travel chute. Simply hover across the gap to reach it.







Minikit Model: AT-ST
The Battle of Endor - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Force, Grapple

Part 1 - Bright Tree Village

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found on a ledge to the left of your starting point. To reach it, stand on this chair.







Your partner will Force it to the left, placing you right next to this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 2
Head behind the large Ewok hut to the left of the first travel chute to reach this hidden Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister is next to some nodes in front of the Protocol panel.








Part 2 - Forest Descent

Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is to the right of the travel chute.









Part 3 - Forest Floor

Blue Canister 5
In the bottom left corner of the first clearing are two purple boxes. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a grapple point.







Use it to grapple up onto the platform, where you'll find this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is right in the path after you pass the first gate.








Part 4 - Bunker Battle

Blue Canister 7
This one is tricky. As soon as you enter this area, head to the right side of the path and you'll find this Blue Canister behind a log.







Blue Canister 8
After destroying the first barrier with the catapult, you'll find this Blue Canister behind a tree on the left side of the path.







Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the bunker.









Part 5 - Bunker Interior

Blue Canister 10
This is inside the left room of the bunker, on the right side.
Jedi Destiny - Story Mode
As the battle between Imperial and Rebel forces rages around the second Death Star, Luke Skywalker confronts Darth Vader - his father, once Anakin Skywalker.

From boy slave on Tatooine, to hero of the Clone Wars, to Sith Lord feared throughout the galaxy, Anakin Skywalker's path has been dark indeed.

In front of Emperor Palpatine, his villainous master, Vader must now face his son, and reclaim his fate....

Enemies: Imperial Guard
Boss: The Emperor
Starting Characters: Luke Skywalker (Jedi), Darth Vader
True Jedi: 35,000

Part 1 – The Emperor’s Throne Room

This entire level is one long boss fight against The Emperor. You’ll start off by dueling him as normal. Take him down four hearts and he’ll hit you with Force Lightning. At this point, switch to your partner and walk up to Palpatine to score a free hit. If you wait too long, your partner will be damaged and you’ll have to wait for him to use Force Lightning again.

Once he’s down five hearts, he’ll hop away and flee to the left. Some Imperial Guards will be sent in, so dispose of them (they take 5 hits to defeat, or you can just Force Choke them with Vader) and head down the steps away from the throne. Some LEGO pieces will be knocked down. Build them into a part of a fan, then Sith Force the LEGO pieces on the wall to reveal more LEGO pieces. Build them into part of the fan.

Sith Force the part with the blade and Luke will Force the other part, creating a fan. Ride the current onto the catwalk, then continue to the left. Approach the panels and Palpatine will electrocute them. Every few seconds, a path will appear of unelectrocuted panels. Quickly cross the panels when it is safe to do so. Keep track of the panels that are always safe, as you can’t cross the panels in one go.

Once you make it to Palpatine, he will stop electrocuting the panels and jump to the center. Duel him to take out one heart, then switch to your partner when he uses Force Lightning to take out another. Repeat this process to take out four more hearts.

He will then leap off the platform and retreat again. Drop down and head to the center of the area, then continue to the left. You’ll find Palpatine again, so duel him some more to take out two more hearts. He will then jump up to the upper ledge. Some LEGO pieces will appear near the lift on the left.

Build them into a generator, then Force one set of lights. Your partner will Force the other, lifting you both up to the ledge. Hop onto the ledge and make sure your partner joins you. Hop across the gap and duel Palpatine to take out another heart. Hop back to the left and take out another heart.

He will then jump back down. Drop down and duel him to take out two more hearts. He will retreat again, so head back to the center of the room. Head to the left and you’ll find him. Take out his last heart to end the level.

Unlocked Characters: Imperial Guard (45,000), The Emperor (275,000)

You will also unlock Darth Vader if you haven’t already
Jedi Destiny - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Imperial, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - The Emperor's Throne Room

Red Power Brick (Score x10)
There are eight red lights surrounding the Emperor's throne.








Quickly Sith Force all of them and this Power Brick will appear on the throne.








Canister 1
This Canister is on a ledge to the left of the throne. Force the LEGO pieces into a platform, allowing you to hop up to the ledge.







Canister 2
In the front right corner of the section with the throne, you'll find this Canister up on a ledge. Destroy the nearby silver objects to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a grapple point, allowing you to reach the ledge with this Canister on it.




Canister 3
Underneath the ledge with the electrocuted tiles, you'll find some wall panels and nodes.








Destroy the panels and nodes to reveal LEGO pieces. Sith Force the grate to reveal more LEGO pieces.







Build them into a platform and a Bounty Hunter panel, then use it to lower a platform.








Hop onto the platform (using the platform you built as a boost), then hover to the left to reach this Canister.







Canister 4
Underneath the ledge with the electrocuted tiles is a door. Head inside to find a set of buttons in a square shape. If you try to step on all of the buttons, you'll see that some don't stay green. That is because of the silver panels on the wall.





Destroy the four silver panels, then quickly step on all of the buttons to reveal this Canister.








Canister 5
Use the Bounty Hunter panel near the center of the area to reveal LEGO pieces.








Build them into a Protocol panel, then use it to extend a bridge.








Cross the bridge to reach an alcove, where you'll find the LEGO pieces for this Canister.








Canister 6
Underneath the final ledge where you battle The Emperor, you'll notice some wall panels on the right.







Destroy them to reveal a travel chute.









Crawl through it to reach the upper ledge, then push the box off the ledge. This will reveal some explosives in front of the door.







Shoot them to detonate them, then head inside the room.








You'll see some chairs that you can Force, so do so.








This will create a tower, so hop up them and onto the ledge, where you'll find LEGO pieces.








Build them into a travel chute, or at least part of a travel chute. You'll notice that the "flap" is missing.








To find it, drop back down and destroy the silver objects to reveal a grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then destroy the silver panels to reveal the "flap".








Sith Force it onto the travel chute, then crawl through it. Destroy the silver fan to the right, allowing you to reach this Canister.







Canister 7
This Canister is in the same room as Canister 6, behind a shield to the right of the entrance. To reach it, Sith Force the barrier to destroy it, allowing you to collect the Canister when you lower the shield.





To lower the shield, destroy the silver panel to the left of the Canister to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into an Astromech panel, then use it to lower the shield.
Jedi Destiny - Free Play Mode cont.
Canister 8
After collecting Canister 7, head back to the entrance of the room. Look on the left and you'll find some nodes.







Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a Protocol panel.








Use it to lower a platform leading to a lever. You'll need to pull this lever to shut off the shield around this Canister.







Once that's done, destroy the silver nodes to the right of the entrance if you haven't already. This will reveal a grapple point, so grapple up onto the ledge and pull the lever.






This will drop a bunch of LEGO pieces onto the floor.








Drop down and build them into a box, then destroy the chairs in the center of the room to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a rotary handle.







Push the box onto the green circular panel, then turn the rotary handle until the arrow on the box is facing to the right.







Once the arrow is facing to the right, push the box into the slot on the right side of the tiles. This will power up the lift.







Catch a ride on the lift and ride it up to the ledge on the left, where you'll find the lever from earlier.








Pull it to lower the shield around this Canister below you.








Canister 9
This Canister can be found behind a shield on the final ledge where you battle The Emperor. In order to lower the shield, you need to Force the four lights, but when you first start out they will all be missing (this screenshot was taken right before collecting it). You will have to reveal the LEGO pieces for each light separately.



The LEGO pieces for the far left light can be found by destroying the nodes on the left ledge. Simple enough.







Similarly, the LEGO pieces for the far right light can be found by destroying the node on the right ledge. The other two lights are more complicated.







To reveal the LEGO pieces for the left center light, destroy the silver panel opposite the throne in the center part of the area.







This will open a door, so head inside and use the Imperial panel.








This will reveal the LEGO pieces for the light.









To reveal the LEGO pieces for the right center light, quickly Sith Force all of the lights on the ledge with the electrocuted panels.







This will reveal some LEGO pieces.









Head back to the right on the catwalk to find the LEGO pieces, then build them into a Bounty Hunter panel.







Use it to reveal the final set of LEGO pieces.









Once the LEGO pieces for all of the lights have been revealed, build each of them. You will then have to Force each of them. You can Force the two center ones right away, but you will have to prep the outer lights. Sith Force the light on the left, then destroy the silver casing over the light on the right. Now you can Force each of the lights, lowering the shield around this Canister.


Canister 10
There is a silver panel in the center of the area opposite the section with the lift.








Destroy it to reveal an opening, then head inside to find this Canister.








Minikit Model: Imperial Shuttle
Jedi Destiny - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Imperial, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

I recommend dueling Palpatine as you progress through collecting the Blue Canisters. One of the Blue Canisters requires you to be at a certain stage in the boss fight, and it can be annoying to backtrack.

Part 1 - The Emperor's Throne Room

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is on a ledge to the right of the throne. Force the LEGO pieces into a platform, allowing you to hop onto the ledge.







Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister is underneath the stairs to the throne.








Blue Canister 3
Before following Palpatine to the catwalk, head to the center of the area and use the Imperial panel to open the door. You'll find this Blue Canister inside.







Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister can be found on the catwalk you reach with the fan.








Blue Canister 5
After fighting Palpatine on the panels he electrocutes, drop down to the main level. You'll find this Blue Canister in the window on the left.







Blue Canister 6
Use the Bounty Hunter panel in the center of the room to open the door. You'll find this Blue Canister inside.







Blue Canister 7
On the right side of the area with the lift, you'll find a series of bright wall panels.








Destroy them to reveal a travel chute, then crawl through it to reach the upper ledge.








Push the box off the ledge to place some bombs in front of the door.








Shoot them to open the door, then head inside.









Once inside, head to the left to find this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 8
After collecting Blue Canister 7, you'll find this Canister to the right of the entrance.








Blue Canister 9
After collecting Blue Canister 8, head to the center of the room to find two chairs. Destroy them to reveal LEGO pieces for a rotary handle. Build it, then head back to the left.






You'll find some silver objects next to the door, so destroy them to reveal a grapple point.








Grapple onto the ledge and pull the lever to reveal some LEGO pieces back by the tiles.








Build them into a box, then push it onto the green circular panel.








Turn the rotary handle to rotate the box. You want the arrow to be facing to the right.








Once the arrow is facing to the right, push the box into the slot on the right side of the tiles.








This will power up the lift. Catch a ride up to the ledge with this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 10
This is on a small platform that you can reach with the lift. In order to reach this platform, you'll need to have been dueling Palpatine, as he will drop the LEGO pieces needed to make the lift move.
Into the Death Star - Story Mode
With help from the Ewoks, the Rebels have finally managed to destroy the Death Star shield generator on Endor.

In the sky above, the Rebel fleet has come under intense fire from Imperial craft and the Death Star itself. Many ships have been destroyed.

But General Lando Calrissian is now able to lead the final assault on the Empire's ultimate weapon, and pilot the Millennium Falcon deep into its dark heart....

Enemies: TIE Fighter, TIE Interceptor, TIE Bomber
Starting Vehicles: Millennium Falcon
True Jedi: 35,000

Part 1 – Star Destroyer Attack

There are four Star Destroyers that you need to destroy. To do so, you need to destroy the two torpedo targets on them. There are TIE Bombers flying around with torpedoes. Destroy the TIE Bombers and steal their torpedoes, then use them to destroy the torpedo targets on the Star Destroyers. Destroy all eight torpedo targets to trigger a cutscene.

Part 2 – Death Star Interior

You are now inside the Death Star. Fly down the path and you’ll eventually find your path blocked by a shield. Grab torpedoes from the generator back up the path and use them to destroy the four torpedo targets. Once the shield is down, continue on.

Part 3 – Reactor Approach

Head down the path and you’ll once again find your path blocked. This time there will be two turrets that shoot missiles at you. Use torpedoes to destroy them. Once both are destroyed, the shield will deactivate, allowing you to enter the reactor.

Part 4 – Reactor

There are several tubes feeding power to the reactor. Fly up to each of the panels on the wall and they will open up. Shoot each of them to destroy them, but be careful, as flying too close will stun you for a few seconds.

Once all of the panels are destroyed, the reactor will be exposed. Shoot it to reveal the core, then use a torpedo to destroy it. There will be torpedoes launched out of the core every few seconds if you need one. Once the torpedo target is destroyed, exit the reactor.

Part 5 – Death Star Escape

All you have do is avoid the fire. Just keep flying straight ahead and spamming your weapons to clear the path ahead. There are three separate “areas” of this, but they are all pretty much the same. Clear the three areas to end the level.

Unlocked Characters: Admiral Ackbar (33,000)

You will also unlock the Millennium Falcon if you haven’t already
Into the Death Star - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: TIE

Part 1 - Star Destroyer Attack

Canister 1
This Canister is on the left side of the first Star Destroyer you encounter.








Canister 2
This Canister is on the right side of the back center Star Destroyer.








Part 2 - Death Star Interior

Canister 3
There are three torpedo targets you can destroy before you reach the shield.








Destroy them all to reveal this Canister in the path.









Canister 4
To the right of the exit, you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, revealing this Canister.







Part 3 - Reactor Approach

Canister 5
There is a hidden alcove to the right of the torpedo generator, where you'll find this Canister. Keep flying past the torpedo generator and the camera will pan to the right, revealing this.






Canister 6
On the left side of the area, you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, revealing this Canister.







Part 4 - Reactor

Canister 7
This is in plain sight on the right side of the reactor.









Red Power Brick (Infinite torpedoes)
There are two torpedo targets on the left side of the reactor.








Destroy them to destroy the panel in the wall, revealing this Power Brick.








Part 5 - Death Star Escape

Canister 8
This Canister is on the right side of the first part of this area. This screenshot is garbage, but if you keep firing and flying forward, you'll collect these last three Canisters.






Canister 9
This Canister is on the right side of the path in the second part of the area.








Canister 10
This Canister is on the right side of the path in the third part of the area.








Minikit Model: TIE Interceptor
Into the Death Star - Challenge Mode
Part 1 - Star Destroyer Attack

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is in front of the bridge of the first Star Destroyer.








Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister is in front of the bridge of the far left Star Destroyer.








Part 2 - Death Star Interior

Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the path, behind the turret. It's easier to collect if you destroy the turret.







Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is to the left of the exit.









Part 3 - Reactor Approach

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the path.









Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is to the left of the exit.









Part 4 - Reactor

Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the reactor.









Part 5 - Death Star Escape

Blue Canister 8
These last three Blue Canisters are tricky, as you actually have to fly through them to collect them. If you fly past them, you can go back into the fire to collect them, but you will take damage and most likely die in the process. This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the path in the first part of the area.



Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister be found on the left side of the path in the second part of the area (it's hidden behind the red beam).







Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the third part of the area. Be careful not to fly out of the Death Star before collecting all 10 Blue Canisters, as you will fail the challenge and have to restart if you do so.
Character Bonus - Endor
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

In the battle-torn forest of Endor, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

This Character Bonus is rather easy. There are lots of enemies to defeat for studs (with lots of the officers dropping purple studs). You can destroy the silver objects for Power Ups, as well as the blue nodes (which are a lot more plentiful). Thermal detonators are great for clearing large groups of enemies if you get overwhelmed (just try not to get caught in the blast). Build the LEGO pieces into gears to raise up the bridges, giving you access to new platforms to devastate.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
Minikit Bonus - Endor
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

In the battle-torn forest of Endor, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

This Minikit Bonus is pretty easy. There are several small patches of forest in this area, and each is filled with plants to destroy. Destroy the white structures with a torpedo to reveal a Power Up, which you can use to really rack up that stud total. Once you have devastated one section of forest, continue on to the next. There will be plenty of AT-ATs and AT-STs bothering you, so make sure to destroy them for studs as well.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
----------Cantina Bonus Levels----------
Pod Race (Original)
Queen Amidala and her Jedi protectors have fled Naboo, heading for Coruscant. They plan to inform the Galactic Senate of the Trade Federation invasion.

However, the Royal Starship's hyperdrive is damaged in the escape, and they have been forced to land on the remote planet of Tatooine for repairs....

This Bonus level can be played after collecting 10 Gold Bricks. This level is the version of Mos Espa Pod Race from the original LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame. This level is dramatically different from the Story version in this game. Allow me to explain.

The basic premise is this: you need to beat a certain Podracer to the end of each section. Each lap is divided into three sections. The first is from the starting line to the end of the crystal cave. The second is from the Tusken canyon to the start of the straightaway. The third is the straightaway that leads to the finish line.

If you do not beat the designated podracer (who will be marked with a green arrow) to the end of the section, you "die" and have to retry that section. There will be a countdown on the screen that tells you how long you have to reach the checkpoint (it counts down from 10). If you lose your hearts, you die and have to restart the section. For this reason, if you start a section with 1 or 2 hearts, I recommend deliberately crashing so you can try with full health.

Unlike the Story version of Mos Espa Pod Race, you will have to accelerate manually. Otherwise, you'll move at a snail's pace. Hold the "jump" button to accelerate and never slow down. Speed boosts are your friend here, as you pretty much need to nail every single one (especially in the final section of each lap) to pass a section.

If you have to retry a section, you will still have to view the cutscene(s) that pertain to each section. You will probably not have a lot of studs (if you have any at all) when you complete this level. Completing this level before playing the Mos Espa Pod Race Story level will not unlock Anakin's Pod or Sebulba's Pod.

I'll give you a quick rundown of what to expect in each lap below.

Lap 1: The first section is rather straightforward. Hitting the service ramp provides a good boost. There are some tight turns in the cave, but don't worry about them and just fly on through. Your first pass through the Tusken canyon is rather easy, just make sure to avoid the blasterfire, as the Tuskens seem more accurate in this version than in the Story version. During the home stretch, watch out for the bombs conveniently placed next to the speed boosts.

Lap 2: The first section of this lap sees the death of Mawhonic. Try to avoid the falling rock, as it can kill you. Note that if you keep having to retry this section you'll have to see Mawhonic die again and again. The Tusken canyon will have a nice rock slide, and colliding with a rock will give you instant death. I find it easiest to avoid this by hugging the left side of the canyon, as the rocks don't really make it to that side. The third section is the same as in the first lap.

Lap 3: Since there was a massive explosion in the previous lap, this lap sees you taking a detour. The rocks are still in the Tusken canyon, and although they're not moving this time, they are still deadly. Colliding with a rock will kill you, so focus on finding a path through the rocks. I usually hug the left, but there is a relatively clear path through the center too. As you enter the final home stretch, you'll see a quick cutscene of Anakin and Sebulba. You gotta beat Sebulba to the end, a task which is made harder by the bombs he is throwing at you. Don't follow directly behind him, as you'll get bombed. Watch out for the rolling bombs and beat Sebulba to the end to complete the level.
Anakin's Flight
As the battle for Naboo rages on the planet's surface, a desperate assault has been launched on the Trade Federation battleships above.

Anakin Skywalker finds himself at the controls of an N-1 Starfighter, heading for the Droid Control Ship....

This Bonus level requires 30 Gold Bricks to unlock. This was intended to be a level in the original LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame, but was scrapped. In this level, you take control of Anakin piloting a Naboo Starfighter as you attempt to destroy the Trade Federation droid control ship.

Enemies: Vulture Droid, MTT, AAT
Starting Vehicles: Naboo Starfighter

Part 1 – Flagship Exterior

Uh oh. Didn't think you would end up here did ya, Anakin? Better help out then. To destroy the ship, we need to reach the reactor, which is inside. The way inside is currently blocked by a hatch. Scattered along the length of the battleship are four torpedo targets. Grab torpedoes from the generator and use them to destroy the targets. Once all four targets are destroyed, the hatch to the interior of the ship will be opened. Fly inside.

Part 2 – Reactor Approach

You are now inside the Trade Federation Flagship, and you gotta reach the core. Fly down the path and you will eventually reach a hanger. The door out of here is shut. To open it, shoot the red target on the left and use a torpedo to destroy the target on the right. You can find torpedoes by destroying some of the MTTs and AATs shooting at you.

Once that door is open, continue down the path to reach another hangar. This time there are four targets to destroy: two by the door and one on each side of the room. Shoot the two red targets and torpedo the two purple targets to open the door. Continue flying down the path to enter the reactor.

Part 3 – The Reactor

Now that we’ve reached the reactor, time to destroy it. Shoot the two red targets on the walls to lower the shield around the reactor. This will allow you to destroy the three torpedo targets. There is a torpedo generator on the right side of this area.

Once the three torpedo targets are destroyed, the reactor core will be exposed. There are 10 small blue domes for you to destroy. Sometimes the shield will extend outward and rotate around. During this time you will be unable to target the cores. When the shield goes down, destroy as many cores as you can until the shield appears again. Destroy all the cores to complete the level.

Unlocked Vehicles: Naboo Starfighter
Gunship Cavalry (Original)
The Grand Army of the Republic has been called into action. Led by Mace Windu and Yoda, the new Clone forces clash with the Separatist droid armies on the planet Geonosis.

Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker engage with the enemy, as they pursue Count Dooku in their Republic attack gunship....

This Bonus level can be played after collecting 10 Gold Bricks. This level is the version of Gunship Cavalry from the original LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame. This level is dramatically different from the Story version in this game. Allow me to explain.

The big difference is that you are on rails. This means that the camera will slowly pan to the right, restricting your range of motion to what is visible on the screen. You also can't rotate your ship in any way, as you are always facing the top right corner. Because of this, try not to let enemies behind you, as you can't shoot back to destroy them, while they can shoot at you.

The studs and hearts from the objects/enemies you destroy will automatically come to you, so you don't have to worry about that. However, if your ship is destroyed, you will have to restart from the last checkpoint. The first area has one checkpoint (after the first shield you deactivate) and dying in the second area will just restart that section.

The first section sees you moving through the canyons of Geonosis, blasting Hailfire and Spider Droids. Be careful not to fly into the large holes or lasers. I suggest keeping your gunship close to the center of the screen so you can see your surroundings.

Eventually, you will come across a ray shield. Instead of bombing the generators like you do in the Story level, here you can simply shoot them. Destroy the two blue generators to lower the shield. Passing through the first shield will trigger the checkpoint, and dying at any point after this will respawn you here. Continue flying through the canyons and lower the next shield. Fly through it.

This next section is also really different from the Story level. The basic premise is the same, you have to destroy the 12 blue generators to prevent the ship from taking off. The difference is there are no bombs, and you have a time limit (I believe it is 1 minute). You'll have to fly around and shoot (not bomb) the laser things to lower the shields around the generators. Destroy all 12 within the time limit to complete the level.

Completing this level before the Story version of Gunship Cavalry will not unlock the Republic Gunship.
A New Hope
It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.

Princess Leia Organa now has the blueprints for the Empire's new weapon, the Death Star. But her ship is intercepted and boarded by Darth Vader and his Stormtroopers....

This level requires 20 Gold Bricks to unlock. This level was a bonus level in the original LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame, and served as a teaser for the upcoming LEGO Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy. This level sees you playing through the beginning scene of A New Hope through the eyes of the Imperials.

Enemies: Rebel Trooper
Starting Characters: Darth Vader, Stormtrooper
Added Characters: C-3PO

Part 1 - The Tantive IV

You are onboard the Tantive IV looking for Princess Leia. Head forward and you’ll find your path blocked by a Protocol panel. We need to find a droid to open it. Head to the left and through the door at the end of the hallway. You’ll find C-3PO in this room, trapped inside some weird container.

He is surrounded by buttons. Destroy the covering on each button, then step on each button in quick succession to raise the container, adding 3PO to your party. Head back out of the room and down the hallway, then use the Protocol panel to open the door.

Before continuing through the door, you can go down the hallway on the right where you can spell “LEGO” by Forcing blocks (like you do in LEGO City, although, interestingly, the “G” is made differently).

Continue on, then use the next Protocol panel to open the door. Continue along through the ship and you’ll come upon another fork in the road. You need to go to the right, but if you go to the left you can enter a bonus room.

Here, you can Force the three piles of LEGO pieces to create a motor. Force it and you'll power the fans in the corners of the room, allowing you to ride the air current and collect some blue studs. The motor doesn't last long however, so you'll need to re-Force it if you want to collect all the studs.

Head down the hallway on the right and destroy the canisters at the end to reveal a Protocol panel. Use it to open the door. Approach the Princess to complete the level.

Completing this level will unlock both C-3PO and Darth Vader if you haven’t already unlocked them.
LEGO City
In an infinite universe, all things are possible.

The epic struggle of the Skywalker family sends turmoil throughout the Force.

And in ANOTHER galaxy far, far away, though, echoes of this drama live on, and a new world awakens....

This bonus level can be unlocked after collecting 10 Gold Bricks. This was a bonus level in the original LEGO Star Wars: The Videogame. It is your standard collect 1 million studs level. While you are timed, there is no time limit.

There are many things you can do to collect 1 million studs. The most basic things you can do are simple: shoot, build and Force everything you can. There are several citizens walking around that can be defeated. There are piles of seeds you can build into the ground. There are windows and doors to Force. There are also more "complicated" things you can do for studs. I'll explain those below.

Build an AT-ST
You'll find this house to the right of your starting point.








Destroy it and you'll reveal the parts of an AT-ST. Force it together. You can ride this around if you want to assist in your destruction.







Restore power to the lights
There are two broken windmills in the upper right corner. Force them back together to restore the power to the city. This will allow you to destroy the streetlights for more studs.






Build and ride a tractor
You'll find this small house in the corner by the windmills.








Destroy it and you'll find a pile of LEGO pieces.









Build them into a tractor, then hop in and follow the stud trail. This stud trail will only appear while you are riding the tractor.







Destroy a house
This house can simply be destroyed. Nothing fancy to do here.








Turn the merry-go-round
There is a small playground in the bottom left corner of the area. In addition to a slide and swings, you'll find a merry-go-round with a silver object next to it.






Destroy it to reveal LEGO pieces, which you can build into a rotary handle. This will allow you to rotate the merry-go-round if you want.







Build a Wookiee Ornithopter
The Wookiee Ornithopter can be built by the fire station. To the left of the fire station is a patch of grass.







Destroy the patch of grass to reveal part of the Ornithopter. You can then Force the pieces to your left onto the Ornithopter.







The next piece of the Ornithopter is inside one of the fire station's garages. Pull the levers on the left to open the garage, then Force the pieces onto the Ornithopter. While you're at the fire station, make sure to destroy the glass tops to the garages. These will give you studs and are very easy to miss.




The final pieces can be found on top of the tower to the left of the fire station. Hop on a Dewback or Tauntaun and ride up to the tower, then leap off to boost yourself up to the roof. Build the LEGO pieces onto the Ornithopter.





When all of the pieces are on the Ornithopter, Force it out of the hole, allowing you to ride it around.







Reveal some hidden flowers
In this corner of the area, you'll find a patch of empty grass. There are actually flowers that are hidden here. You can make them appear by stepping on the correct locations. If you look closely, you can see where some of the locations are (look for the blue dots).




There are 19 flowers to reveal in total. Here is what the completed field looks like. Once you reveal all the flowers, you'll have to wait a second or two before you get the studs.






Build and ride a milk truck
This house with the tiles around it is hiding the LEGO pieces for a milk truck.








Destroy the trashcans outside of the house to reveal the LEGO pieces for it.








Once you've built the milk truck, hop in and follow the stud trail. This stud trail will only appear while you are riding the milk truck.







Ride a Tauntaun
There are two Tauntauns just chilling in a pen. Simply hop on one and follow the stud trail. This stud trail will only appear when you are riding the Tauntaun.






Force the windows and doors
There's not much to do with this building, but you can Force the windows and doors for a small amount of studs. Make sure to destroy the yellow grated windows on the right side of the building.
LEGO City cont.
Build a miniature house
You can Force various parts of this house to reveal LEGO pieces.








Force all of the parts of the house, then destroy the pillar to reveal the final pieces. Build them into a miniature house.







Reveal a hidden house
There is a house foundation surrounded by trees. Simply destroy all the trees to reveal the house!








Build and ride an ATV
As you approach this house, it'll float away, revealing a silver object.








Destroy it to reveal a pile of LEGO pieces that you can build into an ATV.








Once it's built, hop in and follow the stud trail. This stud trail will only be visible while you are riding the ATV.







Release some prisoners
These guys aren't prisoners per se, but they are trapped behind this barrier. Use a thermal detonator or the AT-ST to destroy it.







Spell "LEGO"
There are lots of blocks in this corner of the area. You have to get them to spell "LEGO".








You'll get studs for completing each letter, and you'll get more studs when the whole word is spelled.







Once you collect 1 million studs, the level will end and your best time will be recorded. Unfortunately, you don't get to keep these 1 million studs. If you have done everything on this list and still don't have 1 million studs, run around and make sure you have defeated the enemies and shot and destroyed everything. I usually miss destroying a door or a plant somewhere. The GNK droids can also be destroyed with a perfect lightsaber combo.
New Town
In an infinite universe, all things are possible.

The epic struggle of the Skywalker family sends turmoil throughout the Force.

And in ANOTHER galaxy far, far away, though, echoes of this drama live on, and a new world awakens....

This bonus level can be unlocked after collecting 50 Gold Bricks. It is your standard collect 1 million studs level. While you are timed, there is no time limit.

There are many things you can do to collect 1 million studs. The most basic things you can do are simple: shoot, build and Force everything you can. There are several citizens walking around that can be defeated. There are piles of seeds you can build into the ground. There are windows and doors to Force. There are also more "complicated" things you can do for studs. I'll explain those below.

Reveal 19 flowers
Right next to your starting point is a church. There is a field on the side of it. Walk through the field and you will reveal some hidden flowers.







There are 19 flowers to reveal. Once the flowers have been revealed, you'll have to wait a few seconds for the studs.







Repair the steeple
The LEGO pieces for the steeple are on the side of the church. Force them into position, then pull the lever to ring the bell.







Destroy a house
This house can simply be destroyed.









Send the merry-go-round into space
There is a playground in the right corner of the area. In addition to swings and a slide, you can find a merry-go-round.







Destroy the silver object to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a rotary handle. Turn it around to launch the merry-go-round into space!







Take a boat out on the water
Follow the stud trail by your starting point and you'll reach a boat. Build the LEGO pieces onto the boat, then push it onto the water.







Hop in the boat and collect the studs in the water. The studs will only be visible when you're in the boat.







Take out the ducks
There are some ducks swimming in circles in the water. You can shoot them for studs.








Build a milk truck
This house with tiles on the side of it is hiding the pieces for a milk truck.








Destroy the trash cans around it to reveal the LEGO pieces for a milk truck.








Force a hidden trophy
This house with a black roof can be destroyed to reveal a large trophy.








Force it several times to collect lots of studs.









Build a tractor
This small house can be destroyed to reveal LEGO pieces.








You can build them into a tractor.









Restore the power
There are two broken windmills with LEGO pieces next to them. Force the LEGO pieces onto the windmills to repair them.







This will turn on the lights at the basketball court, allowing you to destroy them.








Rescue a cat
There is a firetruck parked outside the fire station. Hop in and follow the stud trail.








When you get close to the church, the truck will automatically be parked. Force the ladder onto the side of the church.







Grapple up to knock the cat off the steeple.









Ride a Tauntaun
There are some Tauntauns just chilling in a pen. Hop on one and follow the stud trail. This stud trail will only be visible while riding the Tauntaun.







Ride a rollercoaster
There is a rotary handle next to some tracks. Turn it to move the car along the tracks.








Quickly hop on a nearby Tauntaun and boost yourself up to the cart. Wait a few seconds, and the cart will move to the other end of the tracks, allowing you to collect the studs.






Reveal a hidden house
The foundation of a house is surrounded by trees. Destroy the trees to reveal the house.
New Town cont.
Build a miniature house
Force each section of this house to reveal LEGO pieces. Destroy the pillar to reveal the final set of pieces, then build them into a miniature house.







Build an ATV
One of the houses will float away as you approach it. Inside is a silver object. Destroy it to reveal LEGO pieces, which you can build into an ATV.







Shoot hoops
Hop in the turret on the basketball court and use it to launch basketballs at the hoop until you make one.







Spell LEGO
There are several blocks lying around on the upper part of the area. Force them to form letters.








Initially, these letters will spell GOLE. Force one set of letters and your partner will Force the other. This will spell LEGO and net you a large amount of studs.






Once you collect 1 million studs, the level will end and your best time will be recorded. Unfortunately, you don't get to keep these 1 million studs. If you have done everything on this list and still don't have 1 million studs, run around and make sure you have defeated the enemies and shot and destroyed everything. I usually miss destroying a door or a plant somewhere. The GNK droids can also be destroyed with a perfect lightsaber combo.
---------Bounty Hunter Missions---------
Mission 1 - Qui-Gon Jinn
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme.

Their first target: the Jedi Qui-Gon Jinn, currently engaged in a secret mission above the planet Naboo.

Level: Negotiations

Head down the hallway and it will turn to the right. At the intersection you'll find a Protocol panel on the left side of the hallway.







Use it to open the door. Head inside and you'll find Qui-Gon on the right.
Mission 2 - Queen Amidala
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Now the royal leader of Naboo has become a target of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme, and capture Queen Amidala.

Level: Escape from Naboo

Head to the left and shoot the glass dome to destroy it, revealing an opening. Drop down and head to the right. Go up the stairs and you'll find a grapple point.






Use it to reach the ledge above you, then look to the right to find another ledge.








Hover over to the ledge to find Queen Amidala.
Mission 3 - Jar Jar Binks
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

For once, though, Jabba's information is faulty.

On the planet Naboo, he has sent his Bounty Hunters to find and capture the utterly inconsequential Gungan, Jar Jar Binks.

Level: Invasion of Naboo

Head up the path to the right and a ramp will be lowered, allowing you to proceed. Continue to the right into the swamp, where you'll find a crashed MTT.






Destroy the silver turret on it to destroy it, clearing the path.








Head into the alcove and you'll find Jar Jar standing on the left side.
Mission 4 - Mace Windu
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Even the noble Jedi have become targets of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: Mace Windu, currently on Geonosis...

Level: Droid Factory

Head to the right and you'll see some tan pillars. Destroy them to create an opening, then head inside.







Head to the right and you'll find an Astromech panel.








Use it to lower some of the force fields in the room. Head to the left and you'll run into Mace Windu.
Mission 5 - Kit Fisto
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Even the noble Jedi have become targets of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: Kit Fisto, currently on Kamino....

Level: Discovery on Kamino

Head to the left and you'll see Kit Fisto on a platform. Simply hover over to reach him.
Mission 6 - Luminara
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Even the noble Jedi have become targets of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: Luminara Unduli, in the Geonosian battle arena...

Level: Jedi Battle

Head to the right and you'll find Luminara trapped in a cage. Use the Bounty Hunter panel to open the cage, allowing you to capture her.
Mission 7 - Ki-Adi Mundi
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Even the noble Jedi have become targets of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: Ki-Adi Mundi, commanding a Republic Attack Cruiser....

Level: Chancellor in Peril

Head down the hallway and you'll notice a droideka guarding a doorway.








Destroy the droideka (toss a thermal detonator at it), then destroy the silver box to lower a ramp, allowing you to enter the next area.







In the next area, head to the far left to find this Jedi Master.
Mission 8 - Rebel Trooper
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

The greedy mercenaries know no limits in their pursuit of bounty.

On the planet Kashyyyk, they will even pursue a lone Rebel Trooper far away from home.

Level: Defense of Kashyyyk

You'll start this mission in the village. Shoot the two boxes to your right to lower the bridge, then continue to the right.







You'll reach the clearing where the clones normally are, where you'll find another bridge.








Shoot the two boxes to lower the bridge, allowing you to continue on. If you look towards the background, you'll actually see your quarry on a platform on the tree.






To reach him, head towards the tree and you'll find a grapple point.








Use it to reach the platform above you. Hop across to the left, then use the grapple points to reach the ledge where you rescue the first Wookiee.







Look to the left and you'll see another platform.









Hover over to it, then hover onto the next platform on the left. Use the grapple point to reach the platform with your target.
Mission 9 - Shaak Ti
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Even the noble Jedi have become targets of the Hutt's evil ambition.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: Shaak Ti, in the Jedi Temple...

Level: Ruin of the Jedi

Head to the right and you can see Shaak Ti way up on a ledge above the temple entrance.








To reach her, destroy this node on the far right side of the area to reveal a grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then hop up the ledges to the left to reach Shaak Ti.
Mission 10 - Commander Cody
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme.

On the planet Utapau, Commander Cody's high status in the Republic military will make him a valuable prize...

Level: General Grievous

Look to the left and you'll see a platform. Hop onto it and onto the ledge on the left, where you'll find a silver wall.







Destroy it and you'll find Cody on the ledge behind it.
Mission 11 - R2-D2
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Naturally, the evil Hutt intends to take the ransom money, trade his prisoners to the Imperials regardless, and pocket a double bounty.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their first target, R2-D2, a lowly droid made valuable by the secret information he contains high above Tatooine on the Rebel Blockade Runner....

Level: Secret Plans

Use the grapple point on the ground floor to reach the next ledge, then head to the left. Use the grapple point to reach the upper ledge.







You'll find two piles of LEGO pieces, so build them into generators.








This will extend the bridge, so cross it and head through the opening at the other end.








Head down the hallway in this next area and take a right to find a Bounty Hunter panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Head down the hallway and you'll find two grey panels. Stand near them and they will raise up, revealing LEGO pieces.







Build them into a door, which will open up, revealing R2.
Mission 12 - Obi-Wan Kenobi
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.

Naturally, the evil Hutt intends to take the ransom money, trade his prisoners to the Imperials regardless, and pocket a double bounty.

A band of vicious Bounty Hunters has come together to execute Jabba's scheme. Their next target: the legendary Jedi Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi, now an old man hidden somewhere on the planet Tatooine....

Level: Through the Jundland Wastes

You'll start this mission off inside the Sandcrawler. Watch out for the Jawas, as they'll try to zap IG-88 and 4-LOM. Head down the hallway and use the Astromech panel at the end to open the elevator. Head inside.





In the next area, quickly step on each set of four buttons to reveal levers. Pull one and your partner will pull the other, opening the gate. Head into the next area.






Head to the left and use the Protocol panel to open the door.








Head through the opening and go to the right, where you'll find Obi-Wan behind glass. Destroy the nodes to destroy the glass, allowing you to collect him.
Mission 13 - Chewbacca
The vile gangster Jabba the Hutt plans to kidnap leading figures across the galaxy, threatening to hand them over to Imperial forces unless a ransom is paid.
